0.title: Eldhose Paul, 1st Indian to reach triple jump final at World C'ships, finishes 9th
0.article_body: Eldhose Paul, who created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to reach triple jump final in the history of World Athletics Championships, finished ninth in the event. Paul produced his best jump of 16.79m in the three attempts he had in the final. Tokyo Olympic champion Pedro Pichardo of Portugal won the gold medal with a best jump of 17.95m.

1.title: Ganja supplying racket busted in Hyderabad, 4 held
1.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested four persons, including an interstate Ganja supplier, who were found transporting and selling contraband Ganja illegally in Telangana and other states. The police also seized 102 kg of Ganja worth around ₹20 lakh, one Swift Dzire car and three cell phones. The accused and the seized material were handed over to SHO of Hussainialam police station.

2.title: Video shows Neeraj's throw that gave India its 1st silver in World Athletics Championships
2.article_body: Neeraj Chopra was out of the medal race till his third attempt in the men's javelin final at the World Athletics Championships, however, he managed to pull off an 88.13m throw in the fourth round that won India its first silver. Grenada's Anderson Peters won gold with a best throw of 90.54m, while Czech Republic's Jakub Vadlejch won bronze.

3.title: How has Neeraj Chopra performed this year and what is his best throw?
3.article_body: Javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra has finished first or second in all the competitions he has participated in this year. He bagged silver at Paavo Nurmi Games (89.30 metres), gold at Kuortane Games (86.69 metres). He finished second at Stockholm Diamond League with a career-best throw of 89.94 metres. He bagged India's first silver medal at World Athletics Championships (88.13 metres).

4.title: Watching 66 films in short time was challenging: Nat'l Awards jury chairman
4.article_body: Filmmaker Vipul Amrutlal Shah has said that being named the chairman of the National Awards jury was an honour for him. "Watching 66 films in a short span of time was challenging and the entire jury was completely committed to the task," he stated. Vipul added, "They (jury) have done a great job, so my congratulations to all of them."

5.title: Journalist shares pic of IndiGo MD having biscuit & tea onboard, Twitter users react
5.article_body: A journalist on Friday shared a photo of IndiGo’s Promoter and MD Rahul Bhatia eating a Parle-G biscuit dipped in tea onboard. He wrote, "[This] shows you don't have to be Richard Branson or Vijay Mallya to build a successful airline with 57% market share." Meanwhile, a Twitter user wrote, "Grounded and down to earth", and another commented, "That's simplicity!"

6.title: Believe it or not! Indira Gandhi is acting like Kangana Ranaut: RGV
6.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma shared an interview of Indira Gandhi from 1984 on Twitter and wrote, "Believe it or not! Indira Gandhi is acting like Kangana Ranaut." This comes as Kangana is set to portray Indira Gandhi in 'Emergency'. Posting the screenshot of his tweet on Instagram Stories, Kangana wrote, "Thank you...it's reassuring as I cast myself in this role."

7.title: No judiciary in world is as independent as India’s: Rijiju
7.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Saturday said no judiciary in the world is as independent as India’s. His statement came after CJI NV Ramana's remark on media running "kangaroo courts". "Indian judges and judiciary are completely protected. I can say clearly that no judge or judiciary is as independent anywhere in the world as it is in India," Rijiju added.

8.title: Fake news & hearsay: BYJU'S Co-founder on reports of ₹86.21 crore dues to BCCI
8.article_body: BYJU'S Co-founder Divya Gokulnath has responded to reports claiming that the edtech startup owes ₹86.21 crore as dues to the BCCI. Calling it a "fake news story", Gokulnath said, "We expect at least...real journalists to...not get swayed by hearsay and concocted stories by vested parties." Earlier, BYJU'S denied the reports and said, "There are no dues pending from our side."

9.title: 15-yr-old Nagpur boy wins coding contest, gets US job; loses offer after age revealed
9.article_body: A 15-year-old boy in Nagpur bagged a job from a US company after he won a website development contest that he had come across on Instagram. While the company offered him a ₹33 lakh per annum salary, they withdrew the offer after finding out Vedant Deokate's age. Vedant reportedly wrote over 2,000 lines of codes in about two days.

10.title: Eknath Shinde was made CM with heavy heart: Maharashtra BJP chief
10.article_body: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil on Saturday said it was decided with a "heavy heart" that Eknath Shinde would become the new CM of the state. "The central leadership and Devendra Ji (Devendra Fadnavis) decided to back Eknath Shinde as CM with a heavy heart," Patil added. "We were unhappy but decided to accept the decision," he stated.

11.title: I've always tried to follow Stokes, he's a huge loss for ODI team: Curran
11.article_body: England all-rounder Sam Curran, who returned last month from an injury he suffered in IPL 2021, has said Ben Stokes' retirement from ODIs is a "huge loss" for the white-ball squad. "I've always tried to follow the way he trains and the way he plays," he stated. Curran's comments came after his match-winning performance in the second South Africa ODI.

12.title: SP's Azam Khan urges UP govt to provide him 'Z' category security
12.article_body: SP leader Azam Khan, who was recently released from Sitapur jail, urged the UP government to reinstate his 'Z' category security, contending that he and his family faced "many threats". "Right now I have 'Y' category security which is of no relevance," he said. In 2017, Yogi Adityanath's government had downgraded the security cover of over 100 politicians including Khan.

13.title: Twitter spent $33 million on Elon Musk's takeover deal in three months
13.article_body: Twitter spent $33 million on its pending acquisition by the world's richest person Elon Musk during the second quarter of 2022, the company revealed in its earnings release. Twitter also partially blamed Musk for the "uncertainty" surrounding the deal for a decline in its quarterly revenue. Earlier this month, Twitter sued Musk after he proposed terminating the $44 billion deal.

14.title: 1 killed, 6 injured after shooting in Washington
14.article_body: A shooting in Renton, Washington has left a 32-year-old man dead and six others injured and hospitalised with gunshot wounds, police said. An initial investigation indicated a dispute outside of a large gathering that led to the gunfire possibly by more than one suspect, police said. Police added that "this is not an active shooter situation".

15.title: Number of startups in India grew from 471 in 2016 to 72,993 in 2022: Govt
15.article_body: The total number of recognised startups in India rose from 471 in 2016 to 72,993 as of June 30 2022, said Minister of State for Commerce and Industry Som Parkash. In a written reply to the Rajya Sabha, Parkash said recognising this, the Centre had launched the Startup India initiative in 2016 to build an ecosystem for India's startups.

16.title: Hussain Sagar lake overflows due to incessant rain in Hyderabad
16.article_body: Hyderabad's Hussain Sagar lake started overflowing on Saturday due to incessant rainfall in Telangana with the water level rising over the Full Tank Level (FTL) of 513.41 metres. The water level in the lake after incessant rains was measured at 513.43 metres. Due to the overflow, other tanks inside the boundaries of Hyderabad are reportedly very close to breaking.

17.title: Neeraj Chopra wins India's first silver medal in World Athletics Championships history
17.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra has become the first-ever Indian to win a silver medal at World Athletics Championships. The 24-year-old finished second in men's javelin throw final at World Athletics Championships 2022 with a best throw of 88.13 metres. Neeraj is the second Indian after ex-long jumper Anju Bobby George to bag a World Athletics Championships medal.

18.title: Jammu & Kashmir records 557 fresh COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths
18.article_body: Jammu & Kashmir on Saturday reported 557 fresh cases of COVID-19 and two deaths from the infection, officials informed. According to officials, 282 of the 557 cases were reported from Jammu division and the 275 remaining from Kashmir valley. The Union Territory now has 2,801 active cases, officials added. The cases took J&K's total COVID-19 tally to 4,59,544, officials said.

19.title: Brother held after Delhi man found dead in fridge, ₹4 lakh seized
19.article_body: After the body of a 50-year-old man was found stuffed in a refrigerator in Delhi's Seelampur, his brother and another person were arrested in connection with the murder, police said. The accused, Aabid Hussain and Jahid, said they had come to the deceased's house with an intention of theft, police added. Police said they've seized ₹4 lakh cash and jewellery.

20.title: Iraq urges UNSC for urgent meeting over alleged Turkish airstrike
20.article_body: Iraq on Saturday submitted a request to the UNSC for an urgent meeting over the alleged Turkish airstrikes that hit a resort in Duhok earlier this week, the country's Foreign Ministry informed. Baghdad has blamed Ankara for the strike that killed nine civilians and wounded several others on Wednesday. Duhok province is part of the Iraqi semi-autonomous region of Kurdistan.

21.title: Ukraine strikes bridge on Russian supply route in Kherson
21.article_body: Ukrainian missile strikes hit a bridge on a Russian supply route in the Russia-occupied Kherson region on Saturday, a Ukrainian official said. "This is not yet the liberation of Kherson, but a serious preparatory step in that direction," the official wrote on Facebook. A Russia-installed official said that though the bridge was hit, it was still usable, TASS reported.

22.title: 13 killed, 30 injured as rival militias clash in Libya
22.article_body: Violence between rival militias in Libya's capital Tripoli has killed at least 13 people, including a 12-year-old child and wounded 30 others. The two competing militias are involved in a months-long political battle, leading to several clashes. Libya's transition to an elected government fell through last year after an interim government failed to hold polls.

23.title: 27-yr-old arrested for stealing pistol from Army man's home in MP
23.article_body: A 27-year-old man was arrested in Jabalpur on Saturday for allegedly stealing a pistol, bullets and ornaments from the house of an Army officer who was out of town. The accused, Rahul Valmik, hid an iron rod in a broom and entered Lieutenant Colonel Arun Malik's residence posing as a sweeper. Valmik broke the lock using the rod, officials said.

24.title: 50 million facing acute food insecurity: East African Bloc
24.article_body: Over 50 million people in East Africa are expected to experience acute food insecurity this year, the Intergovernmental Authority on Development has said. The eight-country bloc said around 300,000 people in Somalia and South Sudan would experience total famine conditions. United Nations agencies and other groups have recently cautioned over the region's food shortage.

25.title: Couldn't have been better: Nayanthara on Janhvi's remake 'Good Luck Jerry'
25.article_body: Actress Nayanthara recently said that there could not have been a better Jerry than Janhvi in the film 'Good Luck Jerry' which is the remake of her 2018 Tamil film 'Kolamaavu Kokila'. Nayanthara further said, "Kokila is so close to my heart and watching the GoodLuck Jerry trailer brings me so much joy, what an entertaining ride...audience is in for."

26.title: Chennai businessman's wife raped by him & his friend, both arrested
26.article_body: A businessman based in Chennai and his friend were arrested in Thrissur, Kerala, for allegedly beating and raping the former's wife on multiple occasions in the past two years, officials said on Saturday. The police were alerted after the 35-year-old victim went to a private hospital. The accused were also booked for trying to spread the assault through social media.

27.title: Pak's death toll from monsoon rains & flooding rises to 304
27.article_body: The death toll from over five weeks of monsoon rains and flash flooding across Pakistan rose to 304, according to authorities. At least 284 people have been injured in the rains and flash flooding since mid-June. Balochistan province is the worst-hit in the country with 99 people dead in rain-related incidents and subsequent flooding.

28.title: My inspiration is 39-year-old Anderson: Mathews ahead of his 100th Test
28.article_body: Ahead of his 100th Test, Sri Lanka all-rounder Angelo Mathews called 39-year-old England pacer James Anderson as his inspiration. "Being a fast bowler, he still wants to play a couple of more years," he added. The 35-year-old further said that he's still willing to give his best in all three formats. He'll play his 100th Test on Sunday against Pakistan.

29.title: Amit Shah inaugurates sanskrutik bhavan, mid-day meal kitchen in Guj
29.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday launched a series of projects in Gujarat. He inaugurated a CCTV-based command and control room for police in Gandhinagar. Later, he inaugurated the Sardar Patel Sanskrutik Bhavan and Akshaya Patra mid-day meal kitchen in Gandhinagar's Mansa. He said the kitchen will help provide nutritious food to children at government schools in Mansa.

30.title: What are the WHO's recommendations to nations on monkeypox?
30.article_body: After declaring monkeypox a global health emergency, WHO declared recommendations for four groups of nations- those without any cases, with recently imported cases, with animal-to-human spread and those with manufacturing capacity for vaccines. For those with recently imported cases, WHO recommended applying coordinated response, engaging and protecting communities, intensifying surveillance etc.

31.title: 16-yr-old Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa meets Rajinikanth, shares pics
31.article_body: Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa met actor Rajinikanth on Saturday and took to Twitter to share pictures. The 16-year-old met Rajinikanth ahead of the 44th Chess Olympiad, scheduled to start in Chennai on July 28. "A day to remember!!! Met @rajinikanth uncle today with my family! Inspired by his humbleness despite reaching great heights!" he wrote.

32.title: You might see Hardik Pandya quit ODIs after 2023 World Cup in India: Shastri
32.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that Hardik Pandya might quit ODIs after 2023 World Cup in India. "Hardik wants to play T20 cricket and he is very clear in his mind that 'I do not want to play anything else'," Shastri added. He further stated that players choosing formats will become a common thing.

33.title: Nawazuddin shoots for 'Afwaah' in Raj where he shot 'Bypass' with Irrfan
33.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui recentlly shot for the upcoming film 'Afwaah' in Rajasthan where he had also shot for the film 'Bypass' with late actor Irrfan Khan. The film 'Bypass' was screened at the Edinburgh International Film Festival and Aubagne Film Festival. 'Afwaah', which also features Bhumi Pednekar, is a drama film directed by Sudhir Mishra.

34.title: Who are the oldest Indian captains to slam a fifty in men's ODI cricket?
34.article_body: Shikhar Dhawan (36 years and 229 days) became the oldest Indian captain to slam an ODI fifty, during the first ODI against West Indies. The previous oldest Indian captain to score ODI fifty was Mohammed Azharuddin (36 years and 120 days). Azharuddin is followed by Sunil Gavaskar (35 years and 225 days) and MS Dhoni (35 years and 108 days).

35.title: Taliban kill youth & display his body publicly in Afghan market
35.article_body: A young man was shot dead by the Taliban in Afghanistan, local news agencies said, adding that his corpse was publicly displayed at the Andarab district market. The incident took place on Wednesday, following which residents marched with the body and sought an explanation from the Taliban on Thursday. They also fired shots in the air to disperse the gathering.

36.title: Sack Smriti Irani: Congress' Pawan Khera amid 'illegal' bar row
36.article_body: At a press meet on Saturday, Congress leader Pawan Khera said, "We demand from the Prime Minister that Smriti Irani should be immediately sacked as a [Union Minister]...You owe it to this country." This comes amid allegations of Irani's daughter Zoish running an "illegal" bar in Goa. "Was the illegal act carried out without [Smriti's] knowledge or influence?" Khera asked.

37.title: Cuba announces referendum on legalising same-sex marriage
37.article_body: Cuba's Parliament on Friday announced that a referendum will be held on September 25 on a new family law that would legalise same-sex marriages and surrogate parenthood. "We are convinced that in due time, the majority of the Cuban people will endorse this revolutionary, inclusive and democratic code," the Parliament's secretary said.

38.title: Ready to do anything for the team to help it win Asia Cup and World Cup: Virat Kohli
38.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli, who has been rested for the white-ball series against West Indies, said his main aim is to help India win Asia Cup and World Cup. "For that I am ready to do anything for the team," he added. The Asia Cup will begin in August, while the T20 World Cup 2022 will begin in October.

39.title: Centre amends Flag Code of India, Tricolour can now be flown day and night
39.article_body: The Centre has amended the Flag Code of India, allowing the Tricolour to now be flown by the public both day and night. Earlier, the Tricolour was allowed to be flown from sunrise to sunset, irrespective of weather conditions. The government had earlier also amended the provision for material used for producing Tricolour by permitting polyester and machine-made Tricolour.

40.title: 2017 Women's WC final helped turn a page in Indian women's cricket: Mithali
40.article_body: Remembering 2017 Women's World Cup final on its fifth anniversary, Mithali Raj, who led India to the final against England, tweeted, "This day at Lord's in 2017 didn't favour us but I believe it helped turn a page in Indian women's cricket." She added, "It changed the perspective towards women's cricket in India." England defeated India by nine runs.

41.title: When he bats, it seems he's million-dollar: Aakash on Gill's 64 vs WI
41.article_body: Praising Shubman Gill following his 53-ball 64 in India's three-run win against West Indies in first ODI, Aakash Chopra said the India opener batted "extremely well". He added, "The way he started with the drive, after that the punch...he's brilliant. When he bats, it seems he is million-dollar." Gill hit six fours and two sixes during his maiden ODI half-century.

42.title: North Korea warns US, South Korea against military exercises
42.article_body: North Korea has warned the United States and South Korea against conducting joint military drills, saying these exercises were pushing the Korean Peninsula to war. Choe Jin, a senior official in Pyongyang, accused the two countries of planning to deploy US nuclear assets in their future drills. The comments come as Washington and Seoul prepare for upcoming military drills.

43.title: 500 condoms, 400 liquor bottles found in brothel allegedly run by BJP leader in Meghalaya
43.article_body: Six children were rescued and 73 people arrested from a "brothel" allegedly run by BJP's Meghalaya Vice-President Bernard N Marak in Tura on Saturday, said police. Rimpu Bagan, a farmhouse owned by Marak, was raided on the basis of a tip-off. In the raid, 27 vehicles, eight two-wheelers, about 400 bottles of liquor and over 500 unused condoms were seized.

44.title: I was scared of hosting 'Khatron...' due to superstars: Rohit Shetty
44.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty has said that he was initially scared of hosting reality show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' because of the participation of "actors and superstars". He further said that he knew it was the right choice to host it when he heard the TRPs. "My manager came running saying...it's the highest-rated show. I could not believe it," the filmmaker added.

45.title: Preparing to export grain from ports despite Russian attack: Ukraine
45.article_body: Ukrainian Infrastructure Minister Oleksandr Kubrakov said Ukraine continues to prepare to restart grain exports from its Black Sea ports despite a Russian missile strike that hit Odesa port on Saturday. Notably, Russia attacked Odesa less than 24 hours after signing a UN-backed agreement with Ukraine aimed at restarting the grain exports. Russia had blocked the Ukrainian ports amid the war.

46.title: Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee hospitalised hours after arrest
46.article_body: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in a teacher recruitment scam, was admitted to the Intensive Coronary Care Unit (ICCU) of SSKM Hospital after he complained of uneasiness, an official of ED said. According to a hospital official, several tests, including electrocardiogram, were conducted. "He is stable at the moment," the official added.

47.title: Tamil Nadu govt sends more relief material to crisis-hit Sri Lanka
47.article_body:
The Tamil Nadu government on Saturday dispatched another round of essential items to Sri Lanka 
amid an economic crisis in the country. DMK MP Kanimozhi tweeted and said she flagged off the consignment from the VOC Port in Thoothukudi in the presence of state ministers. The relief material included rice, medicines and other essential commodities, valued around ₹74 crore.

48.title: I had promised my father I won't ever lose my dignity: Rupali Ganguly on casting couch
48.article_body: 'Anupamaa' actress Rupali Ganguly spoke to ETimes and shared that casting couch existed in 90s and hence she stepped out of the film industry. "I had a film background but I had promised my father...I won't ever lose my dignity," she said. "I couldn't handle how the industry worked then, especially...casting couch...I decided I can't deal with it," Rupali added.

49.title: Be in no doubt, I'm the underdog: Rishi Sunak on race to be next UK PM
49.article_body: Speaking about the race to become the next UK PM, ex-British Finance Minister Rishi Sunak said, "Be in no doubt, I am the underdog." "The forces that be want this to be a coronation for the other candidate, but I think members want a choice," he added. Foreign Secretary Liz Truss is the second candidate in the race.

50.title: 10 dead, 7 injured as mountain collapses at coal mine in China
50.article_body: Ten people were killed and seven were injured on Saturday after a section of a mountain collapsed at a coal mine in China's Gansu province, Chinese state media outlet CCTV reported. The report said that the landslide occurred while employees were moving around the mining site. An investigation is now reportedly underway to determine the cause of the accident.

51.title: Sri Lankan Cabinet expected to be expanded: Lankan minister
51.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe is expected to expand his Cabinet to include all Opposition parties in it, Tourism Minister Harin Fernando said. Wickremesinghe on Friday formed an 18-member Cabinet after the previous government was dissolved following months-long public protests. The newly named Cabinet has 16 members from the same party, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna.

52.title: 28 kg whale vomit worth ₹28 crore found by fishermen in Kerala
52.article_body: A group of fishermen from Vizhinjam in Thiruvananthapuram found 28.4 kg of ambergris or 'whale vomit' worth ₹28 crore in the sea and handed it over to the Kerala Coastal Police. The ambergris was later collected by Kerala Forest Department. Ambergris, which is produced in the digestive system of sperm whales, is used to manufacture perfumes.

53.title: Alia gave 'Gangubai...', she can demand what she wants: Arjun on pay parity
53.article_body: Speaking about the lack of pay parity in the film industry, actor Arjun Kapoor said that actress Alia Bhatt has delivered 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' following which she can demand what she wants. "You earn your right...It's not even about parity...You should be paid your worth. You have to prove your worth and then you should be paid," the actor added.

54.title: Pak PM's son Hamza Sharif takes oath as Punjab CM after re-election
54.article_body: Hamza Sharif, the son of Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif, on Saturday took oath as the CM of Punjab province after being re-elected to the post following a run-off election. Sharif won by three votes after Deputy Speaker Dost Muhammad Mazari rejected 10 votes of his rival candidate Chaudhry Pervaiz Elahi's party. Elahi has approached the Supreme Court over Mazari's decision.

55.title: Complaint lodged against singer Sravana Bhargavi over music video
55.article_body: A complaint was lodged against Telugu singer Sravana Bhargavi in Tirupati on Saturday over her music video 'Okapari Kokapari'. The song was composed by Annamayya and his followers protested claiming she made the video in an indecent way. Sravana reacted to the protests, saying, "The video has no obscenity...When female singers release a video...some people raise objections and create controversy."

56.title: PFI is like RSS, why do you call them anti-nationals?: RJD leader
56.article_body: In an interview with ANI, Bihar's RJD chief Jagadanand Singh said Islamic terrorist outfit Popular Front of India (PFI) is like Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS). He added, "They (PFI) also want to serve their community...Why do you call them anti-nationals?" He alleged, "Whenever...security forces [arrested people] as Pakistani agents, all of them were related to RSS and Hindu community."

57.title: 40 students fall sick after eating midday meals at school in K'taka
57.article_body: At least 40 students of Government Higher Primary School in Karnataka's Chitradurga district fell sick after eating the midday meal served at the school on Thursday afternoon. Of the 40 students, 26 of them were hospitalised. The food samples have been sent to a laboratory to ascertain if it was a case of food poisoning, school headmaster Doddappa MC said.

58.title: Gem stones worth ₹94 lakh seized in Chennai, Sri Lankan national held
58.article_body:
Over 1,700 pieces of assorted gem stones worth ₹94.34 lakh were seized at Chennai airport and a Sri Lankan national was arrested in this connection, the customs department said on Saturday. 
Initial examinations revealed that the passenger who arrived from Colombo had swallowed packets containing the precious stones. The officials recovered 56 packets containing gem stones from him.

59.title: Crocodiles enter residential areas in Guj amid rainfall, pics emerge
59.article_body: Crocodiles entered residential areas in Gujarat's Vadodara due to heavy rainfall in the area. Residents living near the bank of Vishwamitri River complained about crocodiles entering their homes, Hindustan Times reported. As per ABP's report, teams deployed by Forest Department have captured 27 crocodiles and have released them in the river. Vishwamitri River is home to more than 250 crocodiles.

60.title: McLaughlin wins 400m hurdles in 50.68s, becomes 1st woman to run under 51s
60.article_body: American Sydney McLaughlin broke her own world record to win a gold medal in 400 metres hurdles at World Championships after finishing the race in 50.68 seconds on Saturday in Oregon. She slashed 0.73 off her previous mark of 51.41 set at Hayward Field last month and became the first woman to run under 51 seconds in the event.

61.title: 3 of a family shot dead while camping in US, suspect kills self
61.article_body: Three members of a family were shot dead during their camping trip to a state park in the US state of Iowa on Friday, police said. The suspected shooter was later found dead with a self-inflicted gunshot wound in the park itself, an official added. He said it could not be ascertained if the suspect had a prior criminal record.

62.title: Cow-calf born with 2 heads due to rare genetic defect in Brazil, pic surfaces
62.article_body: Pictures of a two-headed cow baby born on a farm in Brazil have surfaced online. The calf was born with a serious and very rare genetic defect on July 18 and lived for almost four full days before succumbing to it on July 21. Cattle breeder Elidan said the calf died before it could be taken to a veterinarian.

63.title: Odisha school teacher suspended for molesting 15-yr-old girl student
63.article_body: A teacher of a government-run high school in Odisha's Kendrapara district was suspended on Saturday for allegedly molesting a 15-year-old girl student, officials said. The teenager's father, who filed a complaint, claimed that the girl was molested in the school premises. A case has been registered against the teacher under IPC section 354 (outraging modesty) and POCSO Act.

64.title: 1,000 artefacts missing from Sri Lankan Prez, PM's homes: Police
64.article_body: Over 1,000 valuable artefacts from Sri Lanka's Presidential Palace and Prime Minister's official residence are missing after protesters occupied these premises earlier this month, police said on Saturday. Notably, the Department of Archaeology does not have a detailed record of artefacts at Presidential Palace, a local report said. Special investigation teams have been formed to probe the matter.

65.title: Lufthansa is terrible with handling connecting passengers: Rahul Vaidya
65.article_body: Singer Rahul Vaidya made a series of posts on Instagram Stories criticising Lufthansa Airlines. He wrote, "@lufthansa you are terrible with handling connecting passengers!" In another post, the singer wrote, "After @lufthansa making life hell for us back to our best desi carrier @vistara." Rahul returned to Mumbai with his wife on Saturday after celebrating their first anniversary in London.

66.title: Shinzo Abe's suspected killer to undergo psychiatric evaluation
66.article_body: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's suspected assassin will go through psychiatric evaluation till later this year, local media said on Saturday. A court in Nara Prefecture, where the assassination occurred, agreed to the request for a psychiatric examination. The evaluation will ascertain whether the suspect will be indicted for the shooting.

67.title: How does WHO declare an outbreak a public health emergency?
67.article_body: WHO chief Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said he's required to consider five elements for declaring an outbreak a global health emergency, as has been done with monkeypox. The information given by nations, the three International Health Regulations criteria and the Emergency Committee's advice are among them. Scientific principles and evidence and finally risk to human health are also considered.

68.title: Sanctions on Russia failed, EU needs new strategy: Hungarian PM
68.article_body: Hungarian PM Viktor Orban on Saturday said the EU needs a new strategy for the war in Ukraine as sanctions against Russia have proven ineffective. He said that the strategy should focus on drafting a "good peace proposal" instead of winning the war. Only talks between Russia and the US can establish peace as Moscow wants "security guarantees", he added.

69.title: Man killed, 2 others injured after truck-motorcycle collision in UP
69.article_body: A 22-year-old man was killed on the spot and two others were seriously injured after their motorcycle collided with a speeding truck in the Kokhraj area of UP's Kaushambi district on Saturday, police said. The accident happened when the motorcycle rider tried to negotiate a turn, Kokhraj SHO said. The driver of the truck is absconding, he further informed.

70.title: 22-year-old man found with throat slit inside his home in Agra
70.article_body: A 22-year-old man named Ghanshyam was allegedly killed with his throat slit at his house in Prakash Nagar area of Agra, Uttar Pradesh, police said. Ghanshyam's neighbours found him in a pool of blood on Saturday morning. Ghanshyam lived with his mother. However, he was alone when the incident took place as his mother had gone to a relative's house.

71.title: China, Pakistan agree to welcome an interested 3rd country in CPEC
71.article_body: China and Pakistan have agreed to include "interested" countries in the $60 billion China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC), describing it as "an open and inclusive platform" for cooperation. The CPEC is a corridor linking Pakistan's Gwadar Port on the Arabian Sea with Kashgar in China's Xinjiang province. India has protested the CPEC as it passes through Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

72.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till July 27, list released
72.article_body: In its latest bulletin, the IMD issued heavy to very rainfall warning for several states till July 27. It is very likely in Telangana till July 27. It's also very likely over Chhattisgarh and MP till July 26. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Odisha on July 24 & 25. It's likely over West Bengal and Sikkim on July 27.

73.title: 63 lakh Sri Lankans are facing food insecurity: UN agency
73.article_body: UN's World Food Programme (WFP) on Saturday said that around 63 lakh Sri Lankans are facing food insecurity amid the severe economic crisis in the country, ANI reported. The UN agency further said that it has been able to raise only 30% of the $63 million it needs to provide emergency food supplies to 30 lakh people till December 2022.

74.title: Matter of time before Kohli gets back in form: Anjum Chopra
74.article_body: Amid Virat Kohli's poor form, ex-India Women captain Anjum Chopra said she's sure the India batter is doing everything to regain his form. "A player like him must be trying and trying to get out of the slump...I'm sure that it will be a matter of time that he will be back among runs for the Indian team," she added.

75.title: Sushmita represents empowered Indian woman: Pooja on 'gold digger' comments
75.article_body: Actress Pooja Bedi spoke in support of Sushmita Sen after the latter was called a "gold digger" over her relationship with Lalit Modi. She said, "She represents the emancipated, empowered Indian woman that we should all admire." Pooja further said that Sushmita has set the stage for a progressive change as we emerge from a patriarchal, sexist and ageist era.

76.title: Union Home Ministry transfers probe in Bihar PFI case to NIA
76.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) transferred the probe into the Popular Front Of India (PFI) "terror module" case to the NIA on Friday. Earlier this month, two individuals with links to the PFI were arrested from Bihar's capital Patna for their alleged involvement in "anti-India" activities. A third individual was later arrested from Lucknow in connection with the case.

77.title: I got confidence of death bowling from Rajasthan Royals: Chahal
77.article_body: Crediting Rajasthan Royals for giving him confidence of bowling in the death overs, India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said his IPL team gave him a role which helped him to bowl two-three overs after the 40-over mark in ODIs. Chasing 309, West Indies managed 305/6 in 50 overs in the first ODI. Chahal dismissed batter Brandon King(54) in the 45th over.

78.title: 6 students hospitalised after lightning strike near J'khand school
78.article_body: Six students were hospitalised following a lightning strike near the premises of a government school in the Bokaro district of Jharkhand on Saturday, as per authorities. Out of the 50 students who complained of complications after the incident, six were found to be mildly serious and were hospitalised, an official said. Two of those six students lost consciousness, he added.

79.title: Having women's cricket in multi-nation event can be game changer: Harmanpreet
79.article_body: Ahead of Commonwealth Games 2022, India Women limited-overs captain Harmanpreet Kaur said that having women's cricket in the multi-nation event can be a game changer. Notably, women's cricket is making its debut at Commonwealth Games. "This tournament is very important for us and this time we are playing for a medal," she added. The Games will begin on July 28.

80.title: Assam govt approves 2nd wildlife sanctuary in Barak Valley
80.article_body: The Assam government has approved the setting up of a second wildlife sanctuary in the state's Barak Valley, which is home to a multitude of birds and mammals. The Barak Bhuban Wildlife Sanctuary will be spread over an area of 320 sq km between the Barak river and the Sonai river. The valley is already home to Borail Wildlife Sanctuary.

81.title: There was blood coming out of his eyes: Aasif on 'Bhabi Ji...' actor Deepesh's death
81.article_body: Actor Aasif Sheikh, speaking about 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan's death, said, "There was blood coming out of his eyes, it's a clear sign of brain haemorrhage." "He must have not eaten anything in...morning, while playing cricket...his blood pressure must have increased...He immediately fell down," Aasif added. "After 40, you should...not exert yourself too much," he stated.

82.title: English cricketer Northeast smashes 410* in a first-class innings, sets multiple records
82.article_body: English batter Sam Northeast, while playing for Glamorgan against Leicestershire in County Championship, slammed 410*(450) in his team's first innings. He's the ninth batter in first-class cricket to score 400 runs in an innings and the first since Brian Lara in 2004. He became the first-ever Glamorgan cricketer to cross 400. Northeast's 410* is the third-highest score in county history.

83.title: PM posts pics of sky beam light Digital Jyot in Delhi for tributes to freedom fighters
83.article_body: PM Narendra Modi posted pictures of a sky beam light named 'Digital Jyot' that has been installed in Delhi's Central Park and urged people to pay tributes to freedom fighters. People can pay their tributes via digitaltribute.in and the same will be displayed, along with their names and pictures, at the LED screen in front of the 'Digital Jyot'.

84.title: Relative accuses woman of practising witchcraft, kills her in Ranchi
84.article_body: A 31-year-old woman named Seema Devi was beaten to death by her 35-year-old relative on Saturday in Ranchi, Jharkhand, police said. The accused, Baso Devi, had allegedly hit Seema with an iron rod. Police said she alleged that Seema practised witchcraft due to which some villagers had died. However, police suspect that the case is linked to a property dispute.

85.title: Monkeypox declared a global health emergency by WHO
85.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared monkeypox as a global health emergency. Around 65 countries have reported outbreaks of the viral disease as confirmed cases near 16,000. Monkeypox virus is transmitted from one person to another by close contact with lesions, body fluids, respiratory droplets and contaminated materials such as bedding, according to the WHO.

86.title: In difficult times, India's efforts were praised globally: Outgoing Prez
86.article_body: In his farewell speech in the Parliament on Saturday, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "World is struggling because of...pandemic. I hope we learn lessons from the pandemic, we forgot that we're all part of nature." "In difficult times, India's efforts were praised all across the world," he added. PM Narendra Modi and Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu attended the ceremony.

87.title: 4 persons trapped in flash flood rescued in J&K's Udhampur
87.article_body: Four persons trapped in a flash flood in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district were rescued in a joint operation by police and SDRF, officials said on Saturday. Four persons identified as Sanjeev Kumar, Mulkh Raj, Ajay Kumar and Sushil Kumar were rescued from the flash flood in the Barmeen nallah after locals informed the police post in Roundomail, they said.

88.title: Will act after verdict is out: TMC as ED arrests Bengal minister Partha
88.article_body: Following West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's arrest by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in an alleged teacher recruitment scam, TMC leader Firhad Hakim said the party will act "after the judiciary comes out with its verdict". "We're watching the situation and have faith in the judiciary. TMC will not tolerate any discrepancy or malpractice in party or in government," he added.

89.title: People's money being sacrificed for corruption in Bengal: Scindia
89.article_body: After West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee was arrested by Enforcement Directorate (ED), Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said his arrest is evidence of the fact that how people's money is being sacrificed for corruption in Bengal. "People will get to completely know about it, I'm confident," Scindia said. Partha Chatterjee was arrested in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam.

90.title: Parliament is a temple of democracy: Outgoing President Kovind
90.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind, in his farewell address to parliamentarians, termed Parliament a "temple of democracy". "As in any family, sometimes there are differences of opinion even in Parliament," he said. "But we're all members of the 'Parliament family' whose top priority is to continue working in the interest of the big joint family of the nation," President Kovind added.

91.title: Holiday declared in Telangana's Medak after heavy rains kill 3
91.article_body: At least three persons were killed due to heavy rains in Telangana's Medak after which District Collector S Harish announced a holiday as several places were cut off due to overflowing water. Police said two migrant workers from Bihar died after a wall collapsed in Reddypally village on Saturday. Another person drowned in floodwater in Vallabhapur, police added.

92.title: MPs should always follow Gandhian philosophy: Prez in farewell speech
92.article_body: During his farewell address on Saturday, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "MPs should always follow the Gandhian philosophy while exercising rights of debate and dissent in Parliament." "Mahatma Gandhi used peace and non-violence to instil harmony...we must adopt his ways," he added. The President further urged political parties to "rise above partisan politics" in national interest.

93.title: Maoist arrested in Jharkhand's Latehar, arms & ammunition seized
93.article_body: Police on Saturday said that 28-year-old Adesh Ganjhu alias Mangra, a member of the banned Tritiya Sammelan Prastuti Committee, was arrested in Jharkhand's Latehar district in an anti-Maoist operation. "A huge cache of arms and ammunition was recovered during the operation. This is for the first time that ultra-modern 40 mm HE grenades have been seized," Latehar SP said.

94.title: Shot putter Tajinder Toor excluded from CWG 2022 due to injury: AFI
94.article_body: Shot putter Tajinder Toor has been excluded from the Commonwealth Games 2022 squad due to an injury, stated Athletics Federation of India (AFI) on Saturday. Toor had sustained a groin injury in Chula Vista in USA where the Indian team had a brief training stint before ongoing World Championships. The 27-year-old didn't participate in the tournament in Oregon.

95.title: Pune boy secures 81% in CBSE Class 12 exams while fighting cancer
95.article_body: A 17-year-old boy from Pune, who was diagnosed with leukaemia six months ago, has secured 81% in the Class 12 CBSE exams. Ojas Dhankar, who suffered from nausea after chemotherapy sessions in the run-up to the exams, thanked his family, particularly his mother, for support. "It is a situation you're thrown into and I did whatever I could," said Dhankar.

96.title: 18-month-old girl mowed down as father reversed truck in B'luru
96.article_body: An 18-month-old girl was mowed down by her father's reversing truck in Bengaluru's Kammanahalli on Friday. As per a report, Monika Devi was playing outside her house when the truck's mudguard knocked her down. She sustained serious head injuries and was rushed to a hospital. However, she died later. Her father, Balakrishna, is a supplier of construction materials in Karnataka.

97.title: BMC doctors warn of mass-bunk from Aug 1 to protest more workload
97.article_body: Around 1,500 resident doctors of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) hospitals have warned they'll skip duty from August 1 to protest the increased workload due to a shortage of staff. Every six months, the BMC recruits 188 senior resident doctors but the last recruitment has not taken place. Further, the contract of 188 senior resident doctors will end on July 31.

98.title: Pune district records dip in active COVID-19 cases
98.article_body: As per officials, the Pune district is recording a dip in the numbers of COVID-19 cases and active cases. However, the district continues to record the highest weekly positivity rate across Maharashtra. On Friday, the district reported 857 COVID-19 cases, including 506 from Pune Municipal Corporation limits. In total, Maharashtra on Friday reported 2,515 COVID-19 cases and six deaths.

99.title: 25-year-old man electrocuted near storm-water drain in Bengaluru
99.article_body: A 25-year-old man died due to electrocution while allegedly trying to escape after stealing iron rods from an under-construction building near a storm-water drain adjoining Bengaluru's Ulsoor Lake. Police, who rushed to the site and recovered the body, said the man got electrocuted when the iron rods he was carrying came in contact with an electric wire.

100.title: Details of BCCI's non-cricket expenditure of ₹22 crore in last 2 years surface
100.article_body: The BCCI tabled the break-up of its non-cricket expenditure in the last two years at the apex council meeting. The non-cricket expenditure added up to ₹22 crore, including ₹18 crore for Olympic expenses. The BCCI paid ₹70 lakh to singer Mohit Chauhan for India's official theme song for Tokyo Olympics. The BCCI spent ₹98 lakh for Olympics campaign T-shirts.

101.title: Model Arpita, aide of WB minister Partha, arrested after ₹20cr found at her home
101.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Saturday arrested model and actress Arpita Mukherjee, a close aide of arrested West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee. This came a day after the agency said it found ₹20 crore from her residence during raids in connection to the state's School Service Commission (SSC) teacher recruitment scam. Chatterjee was sent to two days of ED custody.

102.title: S Korea to lift its decades-long ban on N Korean newspapers, TV shows
102.article_body: A South Korean official on Friday said that South Korea plans to lift its decades-long ban on public access to North Korean TV shows, newspapers and other publications. The move is part of its efforts to promote mutual understanding between the rivals, the official added. Notably, this comes despite tensions between the two countries over North Korea's recent missile tests.

103.title: Alcaraz will be much better player than me but Nadal is a big word: Ferrer
103.article_body: Ex-world number three David Ferrer said his Spanish compatriot Carlos Alcaraz is a great player, adding he's going to reach number one and win Grand Slams. On comparisons between Alcaraz and Rafael Nadal, Ferrer said that 22-time Grand Slam champion is a "big word". Ferrer further said that the 19-year-old will undoubtedly be a much better tennis player than him.

104.title: UP Police distribute helmets to Kanwariyas on bikes in GB Nagar
104.article_body: The police deployed on Kanwar Yatra duty in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar have distributed helmets and national flags to Kanwariyas on two-wheelers. The police have also set up a control room in Noida to facilitate the movement of Kanwariyas through the city. Police personnel have been instructed to immediately help the devotees in case of any problems, an official said.

105.title: Mulund residents file police complaint against property developer
105.article_body: Residents of Tirumala Habitats in Mumbai's Mulund suburb have filed a police complaint against the 40-storey building's property developer, alleging poor conditions of basic facilities. Tirumala Habitats has 415 flats, ranging from ₹2.25 crore to ₹5.5 crore. Residents said the electric work is done poorly, the lift often malfunctions and safety glasses are missing on higher floors.

106.title: President Ram Nath Kovind delivers farewell speech in Parliament
106.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind, whose term is set to end on Saturday, addressed the Parliament for the last time as he was given a farewell. He recalled the key moments of his five-year tenure and also congratulated his successor and President-elect Droupadi Murmu on winning the election. Murmu will take oath as the President of India on Monday.

107.title: 4-year-old girl raped by 22-year-old man in UP village: Police
107.article_body: A four-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a 22-year-old man named Farid in a village in Uttar Pradesh on Friday night, police said. According to police complaint, the girl was playing outside her house when the accused lured her and took her to a secluded place, where he raped her. The girl is said to be in a critical condition.

108.title: I'd called him days before death, we couldn't talk: Sidharth's cousin Aditya
108.article_body: Late actor Sidharth Shukla's cousin actor Aditya Shukla has revealed that he called the former days before his death. "I had called him but he was busy with his work so we couldn't talk. I wish we had spoken that day," Aditya said. He further said that he was inspired to join the industry after looking at Sidharth's career.

109.title: Kejriwal to visit HP to administer oath to over 5,000 AAP workers
109.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal will visit Himachal Pradesh on Monday to administer oath to more than 5,000 officer bearers of AAP in Solan, ANI reported. Kejriwal will be accompanied by Punjab CM and AAP leader Bhagwant Mann. This comes ahead of Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. Earlier, AAP organised a 'Tiranga Yatra' in Palampur.

110.title: 13-yr-old girl abducted, raped in Chhattisgarh; 3 arrested
110.article_body: Three people, including a minor, have been arrested after a 13-year-old girl was allegedly abducted and raped in Chhattisgarh's Korea district. According to police, the minor boy abducted the girl on July 11 and raped her. Later, on July 14, he along with the other two accused took the girl to a godown and raped her, an officer said.

111.title: See you in court of law & court of people: Irani to Congress over allegations on daughter
111.article_body: Hitting out at Congress for allegations against her daughter Zoish, Smriti Irani said, "Her character was publicly mutilated by Congress spokespeople." She called the allegations against Zoish "malicious" and said, "I'll see you (Congress leaders) in the court of law and in the court of people." Congress earlier held a press conference alleging Zoish's restaurant had an illegal bar license.

112.title: We have to be grateful for push for diversity in Hollywood: Farhan
112.article_body: Farhan Akhtar stated that we have to be "very grateful" for the push for diversity happening within storytelling in Hollywood. "How many actors or people from India were working in other parts of the world 10 or 15 years ago? That has changed...Irrfan...Om Puri...Priyanka (Chopra) is doing exceedingly well and Alia (Bhatt) is also doing a film now," he said.

113.title: Ghaziabad Police busts NCR gang accused of stealing 300 vehicles
113.article_body: Four members of an inter-state vehicle robbery gang suspected of stealing over 300 cars, motorcycles etc. from the Delhi-NCR region were arrested by Ghaziabad Police on Thursday. The gang's leader was arrested from Hint Crossroad in Kavinagar, police said. Based on his interrogation, Ghaziabad Police raided a godown in Sonepat and arrested three other accused, police added.

114.title: India Women should take no team lightly at CWG 2022: Anjum Chopra
114.article_body: Ex-India Women captain Anjum Chopra has said India Women should take no team lightly at Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham, adding all teams are great. She further said, "In T20I and 50-over format, the key difference is that anyone can have a good day." India will face Australia in their first match of Group A on July 29.

115.title: Irani denies 'illegal' Goa bar is run by daughter, says 'she's a college student'
115.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday denied claims that her 18-year-old daughter Zoish was running a restaurant with an alleged illegal bar license. Irani said her daughter is leading life as an "ordinary college student", adding, "Her only fault is that her mother fought elections against Rahul Gandhi from Amethi." She said her daughter's "character was assassinated by Congressmen".

116.title: Yeida allots 37 plots in Medical Devices Park in Greater Noida
116.article_body: The Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (Yeida) on Friday allotted plots to 37 medical device manufacturers through a lottery in its upcoming Medical Devices Park in Greater Noida Sector 28. Yeida will earn revenues worth ₹50.08 crore from the sale of these plots, the authority said. According to Yeida, 39 companies qualified for the draw after scrutiny of 173 applicants.

117.title: Angry villagers in K'taka make buffalo inaugurate bus shelter
117.article_body: Upset with the authorities for not restoring the village's old collapsed bus shelter, locals in Karnataka's Balehosur built a temporary one with coconut fronds. In protest, they made a buffalo inaugurate it instead of a politician. "It's been two years, we've been requesting the local MLA and MP to restore the bus shelter...but nothing was ever done," the villagers alleged.

118.title: Russian airstrikes on Odesa after grain deal outrageous: US envoy
118.article_body: Russia should be held to account for the "outrageous" airstrikes on the Ukrainian port city of Odesa on Saturday, the US ambassador to Kyiv, Bridget Brink, said. The strikes came less than 24 hours after Russia and Ukraine signed a deal to reopen Black Sea ports and resume grain exports. The Kremlin is continuing to "weaponise food", Brink added.

119.title: Will Sisodia too lose memory?: Anurag amid row over Delhi Excise Policy
119.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of shielding the "corrupt" after LG VK Saxena recommended a CBI probe into the Delhi Excise Policy. "There were allegations against Satyendar Jain who lost his memory in jail. Will Manish Sisodia too lose memory?" Thakur stated. "AAP government has set new records of corruption," he further said.

120.title: Don't want to be construed as somebody who misuses surname: Arjun Kapoor
120.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor has said he doesn't want to be construed as somebody who misuses his surname or his lineage. "I'll not disown where I'm from but I'll never misuse it," he added. "I'm somebody who's very, very aware that I'm blessed. And, I'll never, ever misuse it to put somebody down or take somebody else's opportunity away," said Arjun.

121.title: Man held for cheating people on pretext of real estate business in Hyd
121.article_body: The Cyber Crimes division of Rachakonda Police arrested 38-year-old Salavadi Nagaraju for allegedly cheating people on pretext of real estate business, police tweeted on Saturday. A complaint was registered by a Hyderabad resident, who was allegedly cheated of over ₹52,000 by Nagaraju, who claimed to sell a property. A total of 15 cases have been registered against Nagaraju, police said.

122.title: B'luru woman shares video of road with '40 potholes in 200 m stretch'
122.article_body: A video showing a biker riding through multiple potholes on a road in Bengaluru has gone viral on social media. Describing it as an off-roading experience in the city, Twitter user Ankita Banerjee claimed that the 200 m stretch of road has 40 potholes. Reportedly, the video is of a road near Spice Garden Layout at Marathahalli in the city.

123.title: Video shows sinkhole opening under swimming pool that killed a man during party in Israel
123.article_body: A video of the moment a massive sinkhole opened up underneath a swimming pool in Israel during a party, that left a man dead, has surfaced online. Footage showed the hole suddenly appearing and the water receding. The body of the 32-year-old man was discovered hours later at the bottom of the 43-foot-deep hole, said officials.

124.title: Paparazzi call male celebs 'sir', female celebs by name: Tara Sutaria
124.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria stated that a lot of paparazzi videos show them addressing male celebrities as 'sir' and female celebrities by their name. "We're all very young, we don't want to be called 'ma'am' or 'ji'...but it's this general sense of 'the man...must be given more respect'," she said. Tara added that changing small things like these "could move mountains".

125.title: Dialect coach for 'Good...' made me practice 'Lagawelu Jab Lipastic': Janhvi
125.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor has said her dialect coach made her practice the Bhojpuri song 'Lagawelu Jab Lipastic' during her training for 'Good Luck Jerry'. "[It's] an amazing song," she added. "People of Bihar are real fun and their way of talking has a certain...sweetness to it," said Janhvi, who plays the role of a girl from Bihar in the upcoming film.

126.title: Angelina wins legal battle against ex-husband Brad over French winery
126.article_body: Actress Angelina Jolie has won the legal battle against her ex-husband actor Brad Pitt over the Chateau Miraval winery where they got married. They had bought the winery in 2008 for an estimated $28.3 million. Brad filed the case claiming they had agreed not to sell their interests in the company but Angelina sold it to the Stoli Group.

127.title: Monarch butterfly added to international list of threatened species
127.article_body: The migratory black and orange monarch butterfly has been placed in the endangered category of the International Union for Conservation of Nature's Red List of Threatened Species. The butterfly is threatened with extinction because of habitat destruction and climate change, conservationists said on Thursday. Planet Earth is currently undergoing sixth mass extinction driven by human activity.

128.title: IMD predicts moderate to heavy rainfall in Hyd, yellow alert issued
128.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for moderate to heavy rainfall in the next 48 hours in Hyderabad and parts of Telangana. Hyderabad Traffic Police urged people to stay indoors as due to water logging, there is a possibility of heavy traffic congestion. GHMC and Disaster Response Force (DRF) personnel have been deployed on ground.

129.title: Flash floods kill at least 17 peo­ple in south­ern Iran, 6 missing
129.article_body: At least 17 people have died and six others are missing after heavy rains caused flooding in Iran's southern province of Fars, state television said on Saturday. About 55 people were rescued in the flood which submerged 15 cars, officials added. The country's metrology department had warned about heavy seasonal rainfall across Iran, which is facing a decades-long drought.

130.title: Saudi Police arrests man who helped Jewish reporter sneak into Mecca
130.article_body: The police in Saudi Arabia said that they have arrested a Saudi man who helped an Israeli-Jewish reporter sneak into Mecca in explicit violation of regulations prohibiting the entry of non-Muslims. Gil Tamary had filmed himself in Mecca for a roughly 10-minute-long segment that aired on Monday in which he visited a key site on the hajj pilgrimage route.

131.title: Superb my superhero friend: Suniel on Ajay's National Award
131.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty took to Twitter on Saturday to congratulate Ajay Devgn on winning the Best Actor National Award for the film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'. "AJ! Superb show my superhero friend. You kept your word to celebrate our unsung heroes even more proudly," he wrote. "Congrats on the National Award for #Tanhaji," Suniel added with the hashtag "Proud".

132.title: Man hit by local train at Mumbai's Kandivali station, dies
132.article_body: A man died after being hit by a local train at Mumbai's Kandivali station, an official from the Government Railway Police (GRP) said on Friday. "We're trying to establish the victim's identity...[and] track...two others who were seen accompanying him in the CCTV footage," the official said. The victim was critically wounded and died at a hospital, the official added.

133.title: Working on getting Olympics back to London: Mayor Sadiq Khan
133.article_body: London Mayor Sadiq Khan has said that his office is working on the city to get a chance to host the Olympic Games again. "The great thing about London is you don't expend carbon on building new stadiums...because we've got all the kit," Khan said. He added that the plan is in the early stages and would require government support.

134.title: Andhra gets a new floating solar power plant on Meghadri Gedda reservoir
134.article_body: The Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation has commissioned a floating solar power plant at Meghadri Gedda reservoir in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam. G Lakshmisha, Commissioner of GVMC, said that the power plant can produce 4.2 million units of power each year. "Besides that, we're also saving 54,000 tonnes of coal per year and reducing emissions by 3,022 tonnes per year," he added.

135.title: BMC to distribute 50 lakh national flags under 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
135.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to distribute 50 lakh national flags to residents and institutions in Mumbai, as part of the Centre's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. Free distribution of flags is meant to encourage better response, a BMC official said. The BMC has also decided to have a laser show from August 13 to 15 at Marine Drive.

136.title: Mark Cuban reveals his worst Shark Tank investment, says 'all of the money is gone'
136.article_body: Billionaire Mark Cuban recently revealed that the worst investment deal he made on 'Shark Tank' was Breathometer. Cuban invested in the smartphone breathalyser after Charles Michael Yim pitched the idea in 2013. "I'd look at [Yim's] Instagram and he'd be in Bora Bora...Two weeks later, he'd be in Vegas...Next thing you know, all of the money is gone," Cuban said.

137.title: China releases high-resolution pic of Mars' largest moon Phobos that looks like a potato
137.article_body: China released a high-resolution image of Mars' largest moon Phobos on Saturday, marking the two-year anniversary of the launch of its Mars probe Tianwen-1. In the picture, Phobos can be seen as an irregularly shaped object like a potato. Öpik, an impact crater on Phobos named after Estonian astronomer and astrophysicist Ernst Öpik, can also be seen.

138.title: Passengers jump out as train catches fire over river in US, videos surface
138.article_body: Several videos of people jumping out of a train that caught fire on a bridge in the US have surfaced online. Passengers of a Boston Orange Line train were seen smashing windows to jump out on the tracks after a massive fire that broke out over the Mystic River in Massachusetts on Thursday (July 21). The train had 200 passengers.

139.title: That's my most favourite thing in the world: Ranbir on if he procrastinates
139.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor in an interview was asked if he procrastinates, to which the actor replied, "That's my most favourite thing in the world, just to sit and think about nothing." Ranbir currently stars in 'Shamshera', an action-adventure film directed by Karan Malhotra. He will next be seen in Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra'.

140.title: Wife called and was bawling, I started crying too: Siddharth on National Award
140.article_body: Actor Siddharth Menon said that his wife called him after he won a National Award. "She called me and started crying. She was bawling. I couldn't resist and I cried as well. If she cries, I lose it. She is the one, who has seen me so closely through the process of making this film," he added.

141.title: Really well done epic, very powerful story: 'Avengers...' co-maker on RRR
141.article_body: Filmmaker Joe Russo, who is a co-director of 'Avengers: Endgame', said, "'RRR' was a [really] well done epic, (with) nice strong themes [and] great visuals." "[It] was a great movie...and [had] a really powerful story about brotherhood," added Joe. Discussing 'RRR', 'Piranha' director Joe Dante had said, "There's [never] been a more brutal portrait of the horrors of British colonisation."

142.title: I don't have the audacity: Janhvi on picking a Sridevi film for remake
142.article_body: Talking about a film starring her late mother and actress Sridevi which she'd pick for a remake, actress Janhvi Kapoor said, "I don't have the audacity to pick any of her films and be in a remake." "What she...[did] in each of her films is fully untouchable," she added. "[My life with mom around] was a fantasy," Janhvi had stated.

143.title: TMC has emerged as party of thieves under Mamata's leadership: BJP MP
143.article_body: BJP MP and Vice President of party's West Bengal unit Saumitra Khan on Saturday criticised CM Mamata Banerjee over the arrest of minister Partha Chatterjee in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam. "Tomorrow Firhad Hakim will be arrested, then Abhishek Banerjee," Khan stated. "TMC has emerged as...party of thieves and scamsters under the leadership of Mamata Banerjee," he added.

144.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad civic body hires transgender persons as security guards
144.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation has recruited over 30 transgender persons as security guards and green marshals. "We are hopeful that this opportunity will certainly help them in creating their own identity and live with dignity," Municipal Commissioner Rajesh Patil said. "We also have plans to empower the transgender community members by providing financial support to them," he added.

145.title: 7 days after retirement, US sprinter Felix called back at World Championships
145.article_body: Seven days after retirement, US sprinter Allyson Felix has been called back at World Championships to race in the preliminaries of the women's 4×400 relay on Saturday in Oregon. The seven-time Olympic gold medallist ran in what she had said was her last major race on July 15, helping US win a bronze medal in the mixed relay.

146.title: UP man kills 5-yr-old niece for demanding mango while he was eating
146.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly killing his five-year-old niece for repeatedly demanding a mango while he ate his meal. Reportedly, the accused panicked and slit the girl's throat when she started bleeding after he hit her with a rod. The body of the deceased, who'd gone missing on Tuesday afternoon, was found at the accused's home later at night.

147.title: Climate crisis threatens 70% marine life in biodiversity-rich areas: Experts
147.article_body: Over 70% of marine life in the most biodiversity-rich areas of Earth's ocean is threatened by climate change, experts said. "Research shows that locations with exceptionally high marine biodiversity are...most exposed to future oceanic warming," said Dr Stuart Brown. "This is because species living in these...regions are generally ill-equipped to respond to large changes in temperature," he added.

148.title: Video of B'luru parents driving on footpaths goes viral, police react
148.article_body: A video of parents driving two-wheelers with their children riding pillion on footpaths to avoid traffic in Bengaluru has gone viral. The video was reportedly shot at St Patrick's Complex. Reacting to it, Ashoknagar Traffic Police Station tweeted, "[We've informed] the sector officer and patrolling CoBRA to take action against violators." A netizen said, "Sad…teaching the kids wrong things."

149.title: 1st segment of Pune's 3rd Metro line erected at Hinjewadi
149.article_body: The first segment of Pune's third Metro line, being developed by the Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority, was erected at Hinjewadi on Friday. The segment weighs 46 tonnes and is erected at a height of 11 metres between proposed station number 01 and 02 on the 23-kilometre elevated Hinjewadi-Shivajinagar line. "Around 10-12 such segments...used between two pillars," an official said.

150.title: US bans ex-Paraguay President Cartes from entering the country
150.article_body: The US has imposed a travel ban on Paraguay's ex-President Horacio Cartes, accusing him of corruption and links to "terrorist" groups. Cartes, who served as President from 2013 to 2018, had "obstructed a major international probe into transnational crime in order to protect himself and his criminal associate from potential prosecution and political damage," US State Secretary Antony Blinken said.

151.title: Putin's spit into the face of UN chief, Turkish Prez: Ukraine on Russia's missile attack
151.article_body: Russia attacked Odesa sea port less than 24 hours after signing an agreement aimed at restarting Ukrainian grain exports from Odesa and two other Black Sea locations. After the attack, Ukraine said the missile strike was "Vladimir Putin's spit into the face" of UN chief António Guterres and Turkish President Recep Erdogan, "who put enormous efforts into reaching the accord".

152.title: SpaceX breaks its annual record with 32nd rocket launch of 2022
152.article_body: Elon Musk’s SpaceX on Friday broke its record for the number of rockets launched in a year. While the company managed 31 launches in 2021, it aims to launch 52 missions in 2022. SpaceX's 32nd launch of 2022 on Friday deployed 46 Starlink satellites to low-Earth orbit. Notably, SpaceX so far has launched nearly 3,000 Starlink satellites to space.

153.title: People ask 'Why is she in the film?': Vaani Kapoor on 'Shamshera'
153.article_body: Talking about actor Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Shamshera' which released yesterday, actress Vaani Kapoor who stars in the film said, "[People] ask, 'Why is she in this film?'" "People want to know my credibility," added Vaani. "Opportunities [didn't] knock on my door. [Yet], people said, 'She is lucky!'" she stated. "I am the underdog...I am trying to prove who I'm," she said.

154.title: Father catches man who snatched daughter's gold chain in Chandigarh
154.article_body: A father caught a man who snatched his seven-year-old daughter's gold locket after an about 100-metre chase in Chandigarh. "My daughter was crying and all I could think of was getting her locket back," the father said. The father handed over the accused to the police after informing them. The locket was recovered from the pocket of the accused's trousers.

155.title: I wanted them to hit me over the covers: Chahal on 1st ODI vs WI
155.article_body: Team India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said he wanted the West Indies batters to hit him over the covers in the first ODI. "I was...bowling wider because the leg-side boundary was small," added Chahal. Talking about the last over where Mohammed Siraj defended 15 runs, Chahal stated, "There was confidence...but also pressure...When Sanju Samson made that save...it raised our confidence."

156.title: Anti-encroachment drive on land worth ₹40 cr conducted in Greater Noida
156.article_body: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) conducted an anti-encroachment drive against illegal constructions in Sunpura village on Friday on land worth ₹40 crore, officials said. This comes after GNIDA was informed that some people were found building illegal colonies and houses in an area of about 20,000 square metres. "The land lies within GNIDA's notified area," an official said.

157.title: 7 of 19 workers who went missing near China border found
157.article_body: Seven of the 19 construction workers from Assam who went missing near China border in Arunachal Pradesh's Kurung Kumey district, were found and rescued by an Indian Air Force helicopter, said police on Saturday. They were given food and medicines, said an official. Search is on for the remaining workers, for which an IAF helicopter has been deployed.

158.title: Will try to play all 3 formats for as long as possible: Bairstow
158.article_body: After England all-rounder Ben Stokes announced retirement from ODIs citing difficulties to manage workload, teammate Jonny Bairstow has said that he will try to play all three formats for as long as possible. "I don't see myself making a choice [in the near future]...I'm loving being a part of all three squads. They are all different in themselves," Bairstow said.

159.title: A combination of Ranji winners should be fielded in Irani Cup: Ex-India player
159.article_body: Former cricketer Karsan Ghavri has proposed a combined team that consists of players from 2021-22 and 2019-20 Ranji winning squads, namely Madhya Pradesh and Saurashtra, should be fielded in this year's Irani Cup. "It is only fair that the BCCI picks a...squad consisting [seven players from both sides]," Ghavri said. Notably, the Irani Cup 2019-20 wasn't held due to COVID-19.

160.title: 2 CPI(M) workers held in connection with attack on RSS office in Kerala
160.article_body: Police arrested two CPI(M) workers, aged 23 and 27, in connection with the attack on Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) office in Kerala's Payyannur area last week. "As per the preliminary investigation, they both have direct participation in the attack," police said. The incident was caught on CCTV showing several explosions within the boundary wall of the RSS office.

161.title: Centre decides whom to arrest first, then builds 'fake' case: Kejriwal
161.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said there is a new system in India wherein the Centre decides whom to arrest first and then builds a "fake and fabricated" case. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia is going to be arrested soon, possibly in three-four days, Kejriwal claimed. This comes after Delhi LG ordered a CBI probe into alleged violation of Delhi Excise Policy.

162.title: 17-yr-old boy beaten for not chanting 'Jai Shri Ram' in Hyd: Police
162.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was allegedly beaten up in Hyderabad for refusing to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' during a Bonalu (a Hindu festival) procession on Thursday, police said. A group of miscreants had allegedly stopped the victim and told him to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' which he refused to do, police added. The victim is a resident of Hussaini Alam.

163.title: I have a 7-month-old baby girl, she spent 15 days in NICU: Sangita Ghosh
163.article_body: Actress Sangita Ghosh, known for portraying Swaran in television show 'Swaran Ghar', has revealed that she has a seven-month-old baby. Sangita said her daughter Devi was born prematurely on December 25 and was in the NICU for around 15 days. "It's not that we hid the news...we decided not to talk about it till...the time was right," the actress added.

164.title: US announces additional $270 million military aid for Ukraine
164.article_body: The US has announced an additional $270 million in military aid to Ukraine. The aid includes four new M142 High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems and 580 Phoenix Ghost drones. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy thanked US President Joe Biden for the package. These "powerful arms will save our soldiers' lives, speed up...liberation of our land from the Russian aggressor", Zelenskyy said.

165.title: Truck loses balance in Nuh amid rains, rams into autorickshaw; 7 dead
165.article_body: Seven people died while four others were injured after a truck allegedly collided with an autorickshaw in Haryana's Nuh on Friday. "It appears that due to heavy rain, the truck lost balance and collided with the auto, which fell into ditch. The truck also lost balance and overturned and fell on top of the auto, which was crushed," police said.

166.title: Tiger survives after being swept away by strong river currents in UP, video goes viral
166.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a tiger surviving strong river currents in Uttar Pradesh. The tiger was swept away by strong currents while trying to cross the Gerua river in Bahraich district. Using its own strength, the tiger managed to swim to the other side and reach the forest of Katarniaghat.

167.title: If you don't like it, don't look at it: Swara Bhasker on Ranveer's nude photoshoot
167.article_body: Swara Bhasker took to Twitter on Friday to write about Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot. "Daily cases of injustice & oppression in India, but sure... our outrage is reserved for Ranveer Singh's photos!" she wrote. "I mean, seriously...don't like it, don't look at it! Not your cup of tea, don't drink it! But don't 'thopo' your preferences on us!" Swara added.

168.title: BCCI to trial BoneXpert software to detect age fraud among cricketers, to cut cost by 80%
168.article_body: The BCCI will use BoneXpert software on an experimental basis to detect age fraud among cricketers with an aim to cut cost by 80%. The BCCI currently uses TW3 method for age determination. The current method costs ₹2,400/bone test and takes about 3-4 days while the proposed usage of BoneXpert software will give instantaneous result and costs only ₹288.

169.title: Someone please make a film on Geeta Dutt and cast me: Sobhita
169.article_body: Actress Sobhita Dhulipala took to Instagram Stories on Friday to appeal filmmakers to cast her in a film made on late playback singer Geeta Dutt. She shared a video montage of the singer's pictures, writing, "Been saying it in every interview since 2016. Geeta Dutt and Amrita Shergil. I am their biggest fan and am nearly possessed by their spirit."

170.title: Bharatpur seer who set self on fire in protest over mining dies
170.article_body: A seer who set himself on fire in Rajasthan's Bharatpur in a protest against mining at certain hills considered sacred by some has died while undergoing treatment in Delhi. The state government had announced earlier that the area will be declared as forest land following the incident. The seer's mortal remains are being taken to Barsana for last rites.

171.title: Kerala fishermen find 28 kg 'whale vomit' worth ₹28 crore in sea
171.article_body: A group of fishermen from Vizhinjam in Thiruvananthapuram who found 28.4 kg of ambergris or 'whale vomit' worth ₹28 crore in the sea, handed it over to the Kerala Coastal Police. The ambergris was later collected by Kerala Forest Department after police informed them. Ambergris, which is produced in the digestive system of sperm whales, is used to manufacture perfumes.

172.title: Johnny Depp counters Amber Heard's defamation case verdict appeal with his own
172.article_body: A day after Amber Heard filed a notice to appeal the verdict of the defamation case won by Johnny Depp, he filed his own to counter the $2 million he was directed to pay her. Heard's team had filed the notice to appeal the verdict directing her to pay $10 million to Depp by the jury of a Virginia court.

173.title: If we're celebrating Alia-Ranbir, we should celebrate Sushmita-Lalit: Lopamudra
