173.article_body: Actress Lopamudra Raut said that it is unfair to be celebrating Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor but not Susmita Sen and Lalit Modi. "No one has the right to comment on her relationship. If we are celebrating Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor or Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh, we should celebrate Sushmita [Sen] and Lalit [Modi] too," she added.

174.title: BJP won more seats under Yediyurappa: Shivakumar after ex-CM vacates seat
174.article_body: After ex-Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa announced his decision to vacate the Shikaripura assembly seat for his son BY Vijayendra, Congress leader DK Shivakumar said that the BJP leader should not announce retirement as he "still has political strength". "The BJP has won more seats under his leadership but not with the name of another person," Shivakumar added.

175.title: Use of sub-conventional aerial platforms banned in Delhi ahead of I-Day
175.article_body: Delhi Police have banned flying sub-conventional aerial platforms in the national capital from July 22 to August 16 ahead of Independence Day celebrations. The order bans the use of para-gliders, para-motors, hang-gliders, remotely piloted aircraft, hot air balloons, etc. Anti-social elements or terrorists may pose a threat to citizens' safety by the use of these platforms, police said.

176.title: Woman hires bouncers to abduct her lover in Mumbai for refusing to pay ₹5 lakh
176.article_body: A woman abducted her businessman "lover" in Mumbai by hiring two bouncers after he refused to pay ₹5 lakh demanded by her, police said. The accused allegedly assaulted the victim before abducting and confining him in a Thane-based flat. The victim, a resident of Dombivali, was in a relationship with the woman and used to pay her regularly, police added.

177.title: Eagerly waiting to see how Hindi audience will receive me: Naga on 'Laal...'
177.article_body: Naga Chaitanya, who'll be making his Bollywood debut with Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said he's eagerly waiting to see how the Hindi audience will receive him. "I'll...work in Bollywood only if I get acceptance there," he added. Sharing his experience of working with Aamir, Naga said, "It's a dream come true to work with Aamir. He's a wonderful mentor."

178.title: We had confidence Siraj could defend 15 runs in last over: Chahal on 1st ODI
178.article_body: After India won the first ODI against West Indies by three runs in Port of Spain, India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said that the team had confidence that Mohammed Siraj could defend 15 runs in the final over. India scored 308/7 and West Indies managed 305/6 in 50 overs. Siraj posted bowling figures of 10-0-57-2. India lead the three-match series 1-0.

179.title: Man who set ex-wife afire during live stream executed in China
179.article_body: A court in China's Sichuan province on Saturday morning executed a man who was convicted of homicide for setting his former wife on fire. Tang Lu set his ex-wife, Tibetan vlogger Lhamo, on fire on September 14, 2020, when she was live-streaming on Douyin, the Chinese version of TikTok. The 30-year-old woman died of her injuries a few weeks later.

180.title: US exploring whether it can send US-made jets to Ukraine: Official
180.article_body: White House spokesman John Kirby on Friday said that the US is exploring whether it can send US-made fighter jets to Ukraine. "It's not something that would be executed in the near-term," he added. Such a move would be a major increase in US support for Ukraine in its battle against Russia, according to Reuters.

181.title: BJP workers protest outside Sisodia's residence against new Liquor Policy
181.article_body: Delhi BJP leaders and workers on Saturday protested outside the residence of Deputy CM Manish Sisodia against the new Liquor Policy of the AAP government. The protesters were detained by police. This comes after Delhi LG VK Saxena called for a CBI probe into the alleged violation of the Delhi Excise Policy. Sisodia allegedly made "deliberate and gross procedural lapses".

182.title: People who criticise the govt will be punished: Taliban in new order
182.article_body: Taliban has issued a new order saying that those who criticise "Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan" scholars and public servants, be it with gesture, word or anything else, will be punished. In the order, Taliban leader Mullah Hibatullah Akhundzada said that such actions are considered as "negative propaganda" that "unconsciously helps the enemies".

183.title: Farmers, students protest in B'luru against land acquisition in Devanahalli
183.article_body: The All India Students' Association (AISA) and Fridays For Future (FFF) protested in Bengaluru against the government's plan of acquiring 1,777 acres of fertile agricultural land in Devanahalli. According to reports, about 387 families will be rendered landless if the plan goes ahead. "Industries can be set up on barren land, why is...government after fertile lands?" a student activist said.

184.title: We spend sleepless nights rethinking our verdicts: Chief Justice of India
184.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana has talked about "the responsibility of judging", which he said is "extremely burdensome" and takes a "toll on our mental well-being". He said, "Every litigant enters the courtroom with the expectation of obtaining justice." He added, "We spend sleepless nights rethinking our decisions."

185.title: Wanted to join active politics, but destiny had other plans: CJI Ramana
185.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana on Saturday revealed that he was keen on joining active politics but destiny had other plans for him. Speaking at an event, he said, "I was born in a village into an agricultural family and English was introduced in Class 7. After BSc, my father encouraged me to study law."

186.title: I hate watching myself on screen, I don't like anything about it: Disha
186.article_body: Actress Disha Patani said in an interview that she "hates" watching herself on screen. "I don't like watching myself. I can't watch myself...I don't like anything about it," she added. Disha further said whenever she watches her films, she covers her eyes most of the time. Disha will next be seen in 'Ek Villain Returns'.

187.title: Cross-voting in Bihar shows resentment in Oppn: BJP MP on Prez polls
187.article_body: Bihar BJP President and Lok Sabha MP Dr Sanjay Jaiswal said that there is evidence of cross-voting on a "substantial scale" during the Presidential elections in the state. He added that NDA's nominee Droupadi Murmu received 133 votes from the state, while their "effective strength...was 125". He claimed that this shows resentment in the Opposition against their leader.

188.title: 3D printing facility now operational at Airport City in Bengaluru
188.article_body: A state-of-the-art 3D printing facility is now operational at the Airport City that is being developed in Bengaluru Airport premises. "This facility will act as a catalyst to help transform our Airport City into a technology hub," Bengaluru Airport City Limited CEO said. "3D printing helps develop a culture of creativity and scope for scaling innovation across industries," he added.

189.title: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan had collapsed while playing cricket
189.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan, who passed away on Saturday morning, had collapsed while playing cricket. "He went to play cricket with his friends in the morning and collapsed on the ground," his co-star Shubhangi Atre told ETimes. He was rushed to a nearby hospital where he was declared dead.

190.title: Mohammad Shami buys Jaguar F-Type sports car worth nearly ₹1 crore, pic surfaces
190.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami has purchased a Jaguar F-Type sports car, which is worth nearly ₹1 crore. Shami's car is the 2.0 Coupe R-Dynamic variant. The car has a 2.0-litre turbocharged petrol engine. In June, Shami had bought a new Royal Enfield Continental GT 650 worth more than ₹3 crore.

191.title: I don't agree, my knees are already gone: Chahal on if cricket should be played in shorts
191.article_body: On being asked whether cricket should be played wearing shorts due to hot weather, India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said, "No, no. I don't agree with that." He added, "We have to take care of our knees whenever we slide, it's very hard. My two knees are already gone, there are many bruises. I think full pants work well for us."

192.title: Heatwave kills over 1,700 people in Spain and Portugal
192.article_body: The ongoing heatwave in Europe has claimed over 1,700 lives in Portugal and Spain alone, the World Health Organization's European office said. The agency believes the figure would "increase further over the coming days". "Climate change is not new. Its consequences, however, are mounting season after season, year after year, with disastrous outcomes," WHO Europe office Director Hans Kluge said.

193.title: Chhattisgarh to start process to recruit 10,000 school teachers: CM Baghel
193.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has announced that the state government will soon start the process of recruiting "10,000 new teachers" for its schools. "Since 1998, the state government has recruited 14,000 teachers so far," CM Baghel said. He also added that 163 mobile veterinary units would be rolled out soon for the treatment of animals in the state.

194.title: I'm vacating Shikaripura seat, son Vijayendra will contest: Yediyurappa
194.article_body: Former Karnataka CM and BJP leader BS Yediyurappa said on Friday that he will be vacating his Shikaripura constituency seat and won't contest the next Assembly election. He added that his son Vijayendra will contest from the constituency. He also urged people to make sure that Vijayendra wins with a margin "bigger" than his own.

195.title: BJP MP writes to Scindia seeking more int'l flights from Pune
195.article_body: BJP MP from Pune Girish Bapat has written a letter to Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, saying that people have approached him to ask civil aviation authority to start international flights from the city to Singapore, Bangkok, East Asia, Europe and America. "I'll be thankful...if you'll kindly instruct...civil aviation authority to start more international flights from Pune," he said.

196.title: 2 persons test positive for BA.5 sub-variant of Omicron in Pune
196.article_body: Two persons in Pune have tested positive for the BA.5 sub-variant of the Omicron COVID-19 variant, the Maharashtra Public Health Department informed. The samples of both patients were sent to National Institute of Virology (NIV) in Pune. The patients tested positive for COVID-19 during routine screening at Pune Airport, between July 3 and 9, while they were returning from Dubai.

197.title: 2 killed, 1 injured as building collapses due to heavy rains in T'gana
197.article_body: Two people died and one was injured after a building collapsed due to heavy rains in Telangana's Warangal district on Saturday. The incident occurred when the debris from the building fell on the adjacent hut where the victims were staying. The deceased were identified as Tippa Rao and Feroze, whereas a woman named Saleema suffered serious injuries in the incident.

198.title: CCI can't probe Facebook just because it owns WhatsApp: Meta tells HC
198.article_body: Meta on Friday opposed the Competition Commission of India's (CCI) investigation into Facebook in relation to WhatsApp's privacy policy in the Delhi High Court. "The fact that one owns the other...WhatsApp would share something with me is no ground to commence investigation," Meta's lawyer said. "The ownership is common but roads are different, policies are different," the lawyer further said.

199.title: Will give more than 10% of my salary: Guj policeman adopts 100 children
199.article_body: A Sub-inspector in Gujarat Police, Hareshbhai L Jabaliya, has adopted 100 children from government school in a village in Dhari. "I adopted 100 students of 1st to 8th standard of government school, and now I am taking charge of their education," Jabaliya said. He added that right now, he will give more than 10% of his salary towards the effort.

200.title: Couldn't have imagined Nadal, Djokovic, Federer, Murray in 1 team: Borg
200.article_body: With Rafael Nadal, Roger Federer, Novak Djokovic and Andy Murray set to represent Team Europe in Laver Cup 2022, Team Europe captain and six-time French Open champion Bjorn Borg said he couldn't have imagined them together. "I like our chances," added Borg. Djokovic termed Nadal, Federer and Murray as three of his "biggest all-time" rivals, adding it'll be "truly unique".

201.title: Fake doctor working in private hospital arrested in Hyderabad
201.article_body: Police arrested a 36-year-old man for allegedly impersonating a doctor at a private hospital in Hyderabad. The accused, identified as Kudiletti Vijay Kumar, reportedly acquired fake MBBS certificates affiliated to a Russian university for about ₹6.5 lakh and worked at a hospital in Uppal for six months during the COVID-19 pandemic. He later joined a hospital in Meerpet.

202.title: 3 minor sisters, aged 6-9 years, drown in pond in Madhya Pradesh
202.article_body: Three minor sisters drowned in a pond located in Khatami village in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district. The deceased, Asha (6), Kundi (8) and Gundi (9), were daughters of Inam Singh and had drowned while playing in the pond, police said. The deceased's parents got to know about the incident when they were working at an agricultural farm, police added.

203.title: Kallakurichi student's body handed over to parents, last rites held
203.article_body: The body of the 12th class student who allegedly died by suicide after alleging harassment at a Kallakurichi school in Tamil Nadu was handed over to her parents on Saturday. The family of the deceased girl mourned her loss as her body reached her native village in the city. Reports said that the last rites were conducted amid tight security.

204.title: Delhi to start 'Spoken English' course for those who lack communication skills
204.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that the AAP government is starting a 'Spoken English' course for youngsters belonging to poor and middle-class families who lack communication skills. "The Delhi Skill and Entrepreneurship University would be running this course," he added. "In the next year...we will train one lakh students in spoken English at 50 centres," Kejriwal stated.

205.title: 65-yr-old Mindtree Co-founder Subroto Bagchi to complete his DU degree 40 yrs later
205.article_body: With Delhi University permitting former students to complete their degree exams as part of its centenary programme, 65-year-old Subroto Bagchi, Co-founder of Mindtree, tweeted he is a "student again" and will complete his only "unfinished task". Bagchi said that he was enrolled in the Law Faculty in 1978 but couldn’t complete his degree as he had to leave Delhi.

206.title: Dedicate this to my kids, family: Suriya on National Award
206.article_body: Suriya, who won the National Award for Best Actor for 'Soorarai Pottru', has penned a note thanking his fans for their love and good wishes. "I dedicate this award to my kids Diya, Dev and...my loving family," he wrote. "The overwhelming reception for our film, which was released...on OTT during...pandemic, has made our eyes well up in joy," Suriya added.

207.title: CISF personnel shoots self dead at Kolkata airport's staff toilet
207.article_body: A CISF personnel allegedly shot himself dead at a staff toilet in the basement at Kolkata's Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport, police said. The deceased's body, which has been sent for post-mortem examination, was found on Friday after airport security personnel rushed to the toilet on hearing a gunshot, police added. A case of unnatural death has been registered.

208.title: Russo Brothers in talks with Farhan, Ritesh Sidhwani for a collaboration
208.article_body: 'Avengers: Endgame' directors Anthony Russo and Joe Russo are in early talks with Farhan Akhtar and Ritesh Sidhwani, the owners of Excel Entertainment, for a collaboration. "At this moment, I can only say that it's an exchange of ideas at this stage," Anthony said. Anthony added that Farhan and Ritesh have a "brilliant knack for telling disruptive stories".

209.title: Want guys to take risks; continue playing in the fashion we want: Buttler
209.article_body: After winning the second ODI against South Africa on Friday, England ODI skipper Jos Buttler has said that he wants his players "to back themselves and take risks". "It's paramount [that] guys continue to try and play in the fashion we want to as a team," Buttler said. "We're trying to put pressure back on them (opposition)," he added.

210.title: Thai PM survives 4th no-confidence vote in Parliament
210.article_body: Thai Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha and 10 cabinet ministers on Saturday survived no-confidence votes in Parliament. The 68-year-old former army chief received 256 votes in favour and 206 against with nine abstentions, securing his place as PM until his term ends in March next year. It was the fourth time Prayut's performance had been put to a vote since 2019.

211.title: Media running kangaroo courts, ill-informed debates detrimental to democracy: CJI
211.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana has said, "Of late, we see media running kangaroo courts, at times on issues even experienced judges find difficult to decide." "Ill-informed and agenda driven debates on issues involving justice delivery are proving to be detrimental to health of democracy," he added. "Print media still has a certain degree of accountability," he further said.

212.title: NDA stands for 'No Data Available': Rahul criticises govt over lack of data
212.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led NDA government for allegedly not having data on various points. "No Data Available [NDA] government wants you to believe [that]...no one died of oxygen shortage...no farmer died protesting...no migrant died walking...no one was mob lynched...no journalist has been arrested," Rahul tweeted. He also shared a GIF, which said, "Sab Gayab Si."

213.title: Yasin Malik begins hunger strike in Tihar jail over fair trial
213.article_body: Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik has begun a hunger strike in Tihar jail, demanding a fair trial in his case, prison officials said on Saturday. Malik, the chief of banned Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front, is serving a life sentence in a terror funding case. He'd moved an application to the Central government requesting a physical hearing in two cases.

214.title: Kapiva's Dr Anand recommends Hair Care Juice to reduce hair loss
214.article_body: Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda claims that 93% of Hair Care Juice users observed a reduction in hair fall while 72% observed an increased hair growth. Dr Anand, Ayurvedacharya at Kapiva shared that inner nutrition with ingredients like Noni, Bhringraj, Ashwagandha, and Amla stimulates the scalp's bloodstream, replaces dead cells in hair follicles, combats breakage and hair loss due to stress.

215.title: Auto driver gets 20-year jail for sexually assaulting minor girl in Kerala
215.article_body: A 42-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was sentenced to 20 years in prison by a court in Kerala's Kottayam for sexually assaulting a minor girl over a period of one year. The court also imposed a fine of ₹2 lakh on the man. The convict, Sebi, used to abuse the child while dropping her home from school.

216.title: Talk that Kohli should be replaced is too premature: Ajit Agarkar
216.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar said there is a lot of talk that Virat Kohli should be replaced, terming it as "too premature". "There are other players who are performing well but that doesn't mean you have to start questioning Kohli," added Agarkar. India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev had suggested that Kohli should be dropped from India's T20I side.

217.title: Adani adds more wealth than anyone else, gets richer by $36 billion this year
217.article_body: Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani has added nearly $36 billion to his wealth this year, more than anyone else among the world's 500 richest people, as per Bloomberg. Adani recently overtook Bill Gates to become the world's fourth richest person with a net worth of $112 billion. Notably, Adani recently pledged $7.7 billion to charity to mark his 60th birthday.

218.title: No physical classes for kids under 12 in Manipur over COVID-19
218.article_body: Amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in the state, the Manipur government on Friday said physical classes for children below 12 years or up to Class 7 till August 7 will not be allowed. It added that Classes 8 and above will be allowed to reopen from July 25 while observing COVID-appropriate behaviour and adhering to government's guidelines.

219.title: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan passes away
219.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan has passed away. Reacting to the news of his death, actress Kavita Kaushik wrote, "In shock, gutted, pained...Was a fit guy who never drank/smoked or did anything to harm his health." His co-actor Charrul Malik said, "I can't believe it still...I just met him yesterday and he was all fine."

220.title: 3 Kerala policemen suspended after man dies upon release from custody
220.article_body: A sub-inspector, an assistant sub-inspector and a civil police officer were suspended in Kerala's Kozhikode following the death of a 42-year-old man upon his release from police custody. The deceased's relatives alleged that the police had brutally beaten the man. "A report prima facie suggests there were lapses on behalf of the policemen," a police official said.

221.title: England's Jonathan Trott appointed head coach of Afghanistan
221.article_body: Former England batter Jonathan Trott has been appointed as the new head coach of the Afghanistan men's cricket team. Trott will be replacing former English cricketer Graham Thorpe and will join during Afghanistan's tour to Ireland next month, the Afghanistan Cricket Board said. "I'm...excited to have the opportunity to take one of international cricket's most exciting teams," Trott said.

222.title: Waiter stabs cook to death at a 3-star hotel in Mumbai
222.article_body: A waiter allegedly stabbed a cook to death at a 3-star hotel in Andheri East in Mumbai. The accused, Madhav Mandal (27), had an argument with the deceased, Jagdish Jalal (42), over a customer's order at midnight and after losing his temper, Mandal killed Jalal at around 8 am, police said. Notably, Mandal is a resident of Bhayandar, Mumbai.

223.title: 30-yr-old gang-raped by 2 railway employees inside Delhi railway station's staff room
223.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped by two railway employees inside the electrical maintenance staff room of a railway station in Delhi on Thursday. An FIR of gang-rape has been registered and four railway employees, including two who guarded the room from outside. All four accused were arrested within two hours of an FIR being registered.

224.title: If Rajiv was here, I'd have given him something: Randhir on National Award
224.article_body: Randhir Kapoor has said he's very happy for his late actor-brother Rajiv Kapoor whose 'Toolsidas Junior' won the National Award for Best Hindi Film. "If he was there, I would have given him something," Randhir added. "I am very happy. It's a very good picture. He has acted very well in the film. I am delighted," he further said.

225.title: BSF opens fire at suspected Pakistani drone in Jammu; search launched
225.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) opened fire at a suspected Pakistani drone along the international border in Jammu on Friday night, a senior official said. The incident occurred when the BSF troops noticed a blinking red light coming from the Pakistani side. The troops then immediately opened fire at the drone and later launched a search operation in the area.

226.title: Poland to buy jets, tanks and howitzers from South Korea
226.article_body: Polish Defence Minister Mariusz Blaszczak has said that the country will buy 180 K2 "Black Panther" tanks, 48 FA-50 fighter planes and an undefined number of K9 howitzers from South Korea. "We're signing contracts next week," he added. Poland, a NATO member bordering Ukraine, is boosting its defence capabilities in a bid to counter a possible threat from Russia.

227.title: Punjab CM’s residence in Chandigarh fined ₹10,000 after complaints of littering
227.article_body: The Chandigarh Municipal Corporation has imposed a fine of ₹10,000 on Punjab Chief Minister residence in Chandigarh's Sector 2 after complaints of littering by staff and visitors since last year. "Chief Minister is supposed to set good example for the state to follow but...here his own official house is not in order," local BJP Councillor Mahesh Inder Singh Sidhu said.

228.title: Musk is doing his best to run us down, it’s attempted sabotage: Twitter
228.article_body: Twitter's attorney argued that Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "doing his best to run Twitter down" after he terminated the $44 billion deal. William Savitt said, "It’s attempted sabotage." Musk's attorney Andrew Rossman replied, the Tesla CEO has "no interest in damaging the company" and is Twitter’s second-largest shareholder with a "far larger stake" than its entire board of directors.

229.title: Man killed after truck runs over him in Delhi's Geeta Colony
229.article_body: A 55-year-old man died after a truck ran over him near the SDM office in Geeta Colony, Delhi, on Thursday. The deceased, Pradeep Kumar, worked as a typist at the SDM office and was a resident of Delhi's Gandhi Nagar area. Notably, the unidentified suspected driver is absconding while a truck with Haryana's registration number has been seized, police said.

230.title: Mega block to affect services on Santacruz-Goregaon fast lines on July 24
230.article_body: Services on fast lines between Santacruz and Goregaon will remain affected for five hours on July 24 from 10 am to 3 pm as the Railways will be undertaking a mega block. Maintenance work of tracks, signalling and overhead equipment on fast lines will be carried out. During this period, suburban services will run on slow lines between these stations.

231.title: Over 28,000 Indians waiting to adopt child, trend not declining: Govt
231.article_body: About 28,663 Indians are waiting to adopt a child in the country, the government said on Friday, and noted that the number of adoptions is not declining. While responding to a question in Lok Sabha, Women and Child Development Minister Smriti Irani informed that 1,030 foreign applicants are registered with Central Adoption Resource Authority (CARA) for adoption.

232.title: Submit documents to prove majority in Shiv Sena: ECI to Shinde, Thackeray
232.article_body: The Election Commission of India has asked Uddhav Thackeray and Eknath Shinde to submit documentary evidence to prove their majority numbers in Shiv Sena. Thackeray and Shinde have been directed to submit written statements by 1 pm on August 8. "Both the groups claim to be the real Shiv Sena with their leader being the alleged Sena president," ECI stated.

233.title: If someone spent 10-15 days with Raj, they don't have to be assistant: Anees
233.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee said late actor Raj Kapoor was institute and if someone spent 10-15 days with him, they don't have to be assistant. "I was assistant with Jainendra Jain...[in] Prem Rog but due to some reasons...he couldn't do it so Raj Kapoor sir stepped in...it was my luck and then I worked with him for three-four years," he added.

234.title: He was Tanhaji in the truest form: Om Raut on Ajay's National Award
234.article_body: Director Om Raut in an interview congratulated Ajay Devgn for winning the Best Actor National Award for 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior', saying, "He was Tanhaji in the truest form." He added that the film had the "wholehearted support of Ajay Devgn sir, who not only agreed to play the lead but also took the efforts to produce it".

235.title: Putin congratulates President-elect Droupadi Murmu
235.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has congratulated President-elect Droupadi Murmu. In a statement, Putin said, "We attach much importance to the relations of special privileged strategic partnership with India. I hope your activities as the head of state will promote the further development of the Russian-Indian political dialogue and productive cooperation in different areas."

236.title: Best cover shot India has seen: Masaba on Ranveer's nude photoshoot
236.article_body: Reacting to actor Ranveer Singh posing nude, former Windies captain Viv Richards and actress Neena Gupta's daughter Masaba Gupta termed it on Instagram as the "best cover shot" India has seen. "Brave & unapologetic," added Masaba, while commenting on Ranveer's post. "It's so easy...to be physically naked...I can be naked in front of a thousand people," Ranveer had said.

237.title: UP thief being brought to Mumbai jumps off train to escape police; dies
237.article_body: A 30-year-old man arrested from Uttar Pradesh for allegedly committing theft in Mumbai died after jumping off a train near Manmad to escape police. He perhaps thought the train had slowed down, police said. He was being brought to Mumbai. The deceased had recently broken into an imitation jewellery shop in Kandivali and stole copper plates worth a few lakhs.

238.title: Satellite pics show water level at US' largest reservoir at its lowest since 1937
238.article_body: Satellite pictures shared by NASA show water levels in Lake Mead, the largest reservoir in the US, at the lowest since it was filled in April 1937. At its maximum capacity, Lake Mead can hold 36 trillion litre of water and it last approached full capacity in 1983 and 1999. It is currently filled to just 27% of its capacity.

239.title: No ceasefire without recovering land lost to Russia: Ukraine Prez
239.article_body: A ceasefire with Russia without reclaiming lost territories would only prolong the war, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said in an interview with The Wall Street Journal. "We'd prefer to de-occupy in a way that's not military and to save lives...But we're dealing with who we're dealing with. Until they get smashed in the face, they won't understand anything," he added.

240.title: Musk’s team underestimated court's ability: Judge as it sets Oct trial for Twitter case
240.article_body: A Delaware judge while ruling that Twitter’s lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk over the $44 billion deal will be held in October, said his team underestimated the "court’s ability to quickly process complex litigation". Chancellor Kathaleen St. Jude McCormick added, "Delay threatens irreparable harm." Musk’s team while opposing Twitter's expedited trial bid, suggested it be held next year.

241.title: BBMP suspends 2 engineers as roads built before PM's visit wear out
241.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Friday suspended two engineers after roads constructed ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit on June 20 started to peel off. The civic body had revealed that ₹23 crore was spent to redevelop and repair about 14 km of roads, which wore out within 15 days of construction.

242.title: No decision yet on implementation of Uniform Civil Code in country: Rijiju
242.article_body: The Centre on Friday said that it has not yet taken any decision on the implementation of Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in the country. "There are some writ petitions pending in the Hon'ble Supreme Court...regarding UCC. Since the matter is sub-judice, no decision on implementation of UCC...has been taken as of now," Union Minister Kiren Rijiju informed the Lok Sabha.

243.title: Feels like a win, everyone saw what we're capable of: Pooran on 1st ODI
243.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said his team's defeat by three runs in the first ODI against India "feels like" a win. "Bittersweet...but...everyone saw what we are capable of and hopefully we can go strength to strength from here," added Pooran. "It's difficult to lose but we will take this one," he stated. The second ODI will be played tomorrow.

244.title: Didn't expect them to come this close: Dhawan on 3-run win vs WI
244.article_body: Discussing India's win by three runs in the first ODI against West Indies, India's stand-in captain Shikhar Dhawan said they didn't expect West Indies to come this close. "We had nerves...We have to get better," added Dhawan. "We gave doubles to fine leg. One of them should have been a run-out," he stated. Dhawan was the top run-getter scoring 97(99).

245.title: Maha makes fire evacuation lifts mandatory for high-rises equal to or above 70 metres
245.article_body: Maharashtra Energy Department has mandated that all high-rise buildings equal to or above 70 metres (22 floors) across the state should have Fire Evacuation Lifts (FELs). "Evacuation process happens faster through lifts when compared to staircases," Mumbai Fire Brigade chief fire officer said. Notably, only 13 high-rises out of 368 skyscrapers in Mumbai are equipped with FELs.

246.title: Principal's 20-yr-old son sexually assaults 9-yr-old student in Hyd
246.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested on Friday for allegedly sexually assaulting a nine-year-old female student in a room on the terrace of a private school in Hyderabad's Moin Bagh. The accused is the son of the school's principal. A case was filed under sections of the Indian Penal Code and the POCSO Act after the girl's parents filed a complaint.

247.title: Bengaluru Metro becomes first in India to conduct 5G network trials
247.article_body: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) on Friday said it has become the first Metro in India to test 5G network. The 5G network, deployed at MG Road station, was tested under a pilot project of TRAI (Telecom Regulatory Authority of India). It gave a download speed of 1.4 Gbps and an upload speed of 65 Mbps, BMRCL tweeted.

248.title: $130 billion wiped off social media companies' market value in a day
248.article_body: American social media companies lost more than $130 billion from their combined stock market value on Friday. The wipeout comes after Twitter and Snap's quarterly results raised concerns about the outlook for online advertising. Shares of Snap fell 39% to its lowest level since March 2020, whereas Alphabet stock declined 5.6% in its biggest one-day drop in over 2 years.

249.title: Woman lay dead in UK flat for over 2 years; landlord kept taking rent
249.article_body: A landlord in the UK cut off gas and kept taking rent from a tenant as she lay dead in the flat for over two years. The remains of the woman, Sheila Seleoane, were found in February. She had to be identified by dental records after her skeletal remains were found on the sofa in the living room.

250.title: People haven't lost faith in MVA, they're disgusted by dirty politics: Aaditya
250.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray has said that the people haven't lost faith in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA), rather they're "disgusted with the dirty politics of greed" displayed by the rebel party leaders. He also blamed the "greed of traitors" for the split in the party, adding, "The other blame may be is on us, for trusting too much."

251.title: Hotel manager puts liquor sale ad outside Pune university, held
251.article_body: Pune police have arrested a hotel manager based on a Facebook post by an advocate alleging that the hotel had put up an advertisement for the sale of liquor outside a private university. The advertisement, stating- "unlimited liquor for two hours for ₹799", was put up despite a liquor sale ban within 100 metres of an educational institution's entrance.

252.title: Feels like I've done something good: 'Soorarai...' maker on National Award win
252.article_body: Director Sudha Kongara, whose 'Soorarai Pottru' won multiple awards at the 68th National Film Awards, said, "I feel fantastic that a mainstream film is getting...National Award." "It feels damn good and feels like I've done something good," she added. 'Soorarai Pottru' was awarded in the Best Feature Film, Best Screenplay and Best Music Direction (Background Music) categories.

253.title: Attackers beat Raj Sikh Granthi, talk of cutting neck; put chilli in eyes
253.article_body: Unidentified attackers beat up a Sikh Granthi in Rajasthan's Alwar, reports said. A report that was filed with police said that the attackers were talking of cutting off the Granthi's neck. The victim reportedly said that the attackers cut off his hair. Reports added that they also put chilli powder in the victim's eyes.

254.title: People tell me 'you started a makeup company because you look bad': Vineeta Singh
254.article_body: SUGAR Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh, speaking about facing online trolls, said, "I'm the CEO of a company...even now, people are...commenting things like...'You started a makeup company because you look so bad'." The Shark Tank India judge added, "I've achieved so much in life, but when I post something [on Instagram], 95% of the comments are about the way [I] look."

255.title: Russia claims it destroyed 4 US-made HIMARS launchers in Ukraine
255.article_body: The Russian Defence Ministry on Friday said that its forces have destroyed four US-made High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems (HIMARS) in Ukraine. The "four launchers and one reloading vehicle for the HIMARS were destroyed" between July 5-20, the ministry added. Ukraine has rejected Moscow's claims, calling them "fakes" designed to undermine the West's support for the country.

256.title: So happy and proud: Kajol as 'Tanhaji...' wins 3 National Awards
256.article_body: After her film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' won three National Awards, Kajol wrote on Instagram, "So happy and proud." The Om Raut directorial won the National Awards for Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment and Best Costume Design. Ajay Devgn was awarded the Best Actor for his performance in the film. Kajol played the role of Savitribai Malusare.

257.title: West Bengal minister Partha arrested by ED after ₹20 crore cash found at aide's home
257.article_body: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee has been arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam. The ED on Friday recovered ₹20 crore in cash from the house of an aide of Chatterjee. "The said amount is suspected to be proceeds of crime of the said SSC scam," the probe agency had said.

258.title: I like getting kicked in matches: Manchester City's Jack Grealish
258.article_body: Manchester City's Jack Grealish, who's the most expensive Premier League footballer, said he "likes" getting kicked by opponents during matches. "It gets me going...I get it at a lot of places," added Grealish. Grealish joined City from Aston Villa for £100 million. Talking about Grealish, ex-Aston Villa manager Tim Sherwood earlier said he hadn't seen anyone get kicked so much.

259.title: 79-yr-old Ashok Soota launches his 3rd startup, aims to take it to IPO in 5 yrs
259.article_body: Entrepreneur Ashok Soota, 79, has launched his latest venture Happiest Health, which he aims to take to IPO in five years. Soota worked at Wipro from 1985 to 1999, after which he quit and co-founded rival company Mindtree Limited, bringing it to an IPO in 2007. He then founded Happiest Minds Technologies in 2011, which had its IPO in 2020.

260.title: Trump's former advisor found guilty of contempt of Congress
260.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's ex-advisor Steve Bannon was convicted on Friday of contempt of Congress for defying a congressional subpoena from the US House committee probing the Capitol riot. Bannon was found guilty of refusing to appear for a deposition and refusing to provide documents in response to the committee's subpoena. He faces up to two years in jail.

261.title: 2 brothers beaten up in Delhi’s Shahdara for objecting to drinking in public
261.article_body: A 25-year-old man and his brother were allegedly beaten up in Delhi's Shahdara for objecting to a man drinking and smoking outside a public toilet. Police have arrested two persons named Shahrukh and Aamir. The incident took place on Wednesday night when Danish, who sells lemons in the market, asked Shahrukh not to drink in open, leading to an argument.

262.title: Bihar man asks for ₹600 he lent, dies after head smashed on road
262.article_body: A man from Bihar, Bharat Shah, died after his head was allegedly smashed on the road after he asked to be returned ₹600 that he lent to a man. Bharat had lent ₹600 to a man, Mohammad Faizal, to book a train ticket in May this year. Fight broke out between them when Shah went to ask for his money.

263.title: Govt has no data on Anganwadi workers who died due to COVID-19: Irani
263.article_body: Women and Child Development Minister Smriti Irani informed the Lok Sabha on Friday that the government has no data on the number of Anganwadi workers who died due to COVID-19. "As Anganwadi services is a scheme implemented by states/UTs, the data on the number of Anganwadi workers who died due to coronavirus is not available with this ministry," Irani added.

264.title: AAP to contest all wards in B'luru civic polls, invites candidates
264.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party Karnataka chief Prithvi Reddy on Friday said that the party will contest polls in all wards of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). "As a part of the 'One Chance to Kejriwal' campaign, a Candidate Search Committee has been formed," Reddy said. We invite people from different walks of life to fight elections, he added.

265.title: Active COVID-19 cases in India cross 1,50,000 mark
265.article_body: Active COVID-19 cases in India have crossed the 1,50,000 mark as the country reported 21,411 cases and 67 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 21,880 COVID-19 cases. The number of COVID-19 deaths in the country has risen to 5,25,997.

266.title: Bengaluru reports 1,244 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
266.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,244 new COVID-19 cases and 996 recoveries, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Friday. The number of active cases was 7,355, while the infection positivity rate stood at 6.63%. No deaths were reported in this period. Nearly two crore vaccines have been administered so far in the city.

267.title: Rachakonda Police bust human trafficking racket, 2 women rescued
267.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Friday said that they have busted an inter-state human trafficking racket and arrested six persons. Police also rescued two Bangladeshi sisters, including a 15-year-old girl, during the operation. According to police, the accused had links to Jharkhand, Maharashtra and Rajasthan and smuggled young girls from Bangladesh and other parts of the country into the city.

268.title: Man sucked to his death as sinkhole opens under swimming pool during party in Israel
268.article_body: A man was sucked to his death after a sinkhole opened under a swimming pool he was in at a house party in Israel. The incident happened at a villa which was hosting a company event in the central town of Karmi Yosef. The victim has been identified as a 32-year-old employee of the company.

269.title: That run-out was too casual: Agarkar on Gill's dismissal in 1st ODI
269.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar said Shubman Gill's dismissal after getting run-out in the first ODI against West Indies was "too casual". "That (run-out) is the one thing you don't want to do. Shikhar Dhawan is probably going to teach him today, that once you get a start, don't...give it away," added Agarkar. Gill scored 64 runs in 53 balls.

270.title: May shift business from Zomato, Swiggy if commissions rise: Domino's
270.article_body: Jubilant FoodWorks, which runs the Domino's and Dunkin' Donuts chain in India, has said that it will consider taking some of its business away from Zomato and Swiggy, if their commissions rise further. The company was responding to the Competition Commission of India, which is investigating the alleged anti-competitive practices of Zomato and Swiggy.

271.title: Body of 50-year-old man found stuffed in fridge in Delhi, probe on
271.article_body: An investigation was launched after the body of a 50-year-old man was found stuffed in a refrigerator in his house in Northeast Delhi's Seelampur. Primary inquiry said that the man lived alone in the house and his wife and children lived separately at a distance. Police said that a caller informed them that her relative was not attending calls.

272.title: Ghaziabad man stabs wife to death following an argument
272.article_body: A 40-year-old man stabbed his wife to death following an argument in Sector 15, Vasundhara in Ghaziabad. Later, the accused, Vikas Meena, jumped off the building's top floor and sustained a fracture, police said. Vikas' father, Jagdish, claimed that his son suspected that the deceased, Kamini (35), was having an extramarital affair. Notably, Vikas is undergoing treatment at a hospital.

273.title: SC stays HC order refusing to dismiss corruption case against Yediyurappa
273.article_body: Supreme Court granted an interim stay on Karnataka HC order refusing to dismiss corruption charges against former CM BS Yediyurappa in connection with an illegal land denotification case of 2006-07. Yediyurappa's counsel said the probe against him was an abuse of the judicial process. Yediyurappa had "misused his official powers in facilitating large-scale misuse of land", as per the complainant.

274.title: Delhi Police beat us, touched inappropriately in Dwarka: Transpersons
274.article_body: A group of transpersons alleged that they were beaten up mercilessly with sticks and one of them was touched inappropriately by Delhi Police at Dwarka's Dabri Police Station. They alleged police took a person from the shelter home who they said was reported missing by parents and sent the person away. When they objected, they were reportedly assaulted.

275.title: Suspecting stay with another man, Maha man stabs wife 10-12 times; kills her
275.article_body: Suspecting that his wife was staying with another man, a man from Navi Mumbai's Vashi stabbed his wife to death on Friday. Reports said that he stabbed his wife 10-12 times. The accused allegedly also attacked his friend and a pedestrian, both of whom tried to stop him. The accused injured himself too and is admitted to hospital currently.

276.title: Ukraine has around $10 bn worth of grain available for sale: Zelenskyy
276.article_body: After Ukraine and Russia sealed a deal with Turkey and UN to restart the export of Ukrainian grains, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Ukraine has around $10 billion worth of grain available for sale. "This is another demonstration that Ukraine can withstand...war," he added. The Russian military's blockade of Ukrainian ports had halted grain exports, causing a global food crisis.

277.title: Fruits worth lakhs damaged, washed away due to heavy rains in Hyd
277.article_body: Fruits worth lakhs of rupees were damaged in Hyderabad's Batasingaram fruit market on Friday as the city witnessed heavy rains. A lot of sweet limes, pomegranates, apples and other fruits were washed away as rainwater collected in the market, according to traders. Following this, authorities put up a shed at the market as it was shifted to a safer location.

278.title: 44-yr-old lawyer shoots himself to death in Hyderabad
278.article_body: A 44-year-old lawyer allegedly shot himself dead at his residence in Hyderabad's Bagh Lingampally area on Friday, police said. The deceased, identified as Shiva Reddy, had retired as sergeant from the Air Force and was currently practicing as an advocate. Shiva was a divorcee and lived alone, police said. He is suspected to have shot himself with his licensed pistol.

279.title: Pantry car staffer, 2 others held in Pune over girl's rape in train
279.article_body: Railway police have arrested three people, including a pantry car staffer, from Pune over the alleged rape of a 14-year-old girl in the pantry car of the Jhelum Express train. The incident occurred on July 19 when the girl inadvertently boarded the train, the police said. The girl has identified the main accused in the case, the police added.

280.title: Saw myself in burning grave in dreams: Sana Khan on quitting showbiz
280.article_body: Discussing her decision to quit her showbiz lifestyle forever in 2020, former actress Sana Khan said, "[During] Ramadan 2019, I used to...see myself in [a] burning and blazing grave [in my dreams]." "In my past life, of course, I had everything, I had fame, name, money...[The] one thing that was missing was 'peace in my heart'...I was...depressed," she added.

281.title: US reports its first cases of monkeypox in children
281.article_body: The US has reported its first cases of monkeypox in children, with health authorities saying that one patient is a California toddler and the other is a non-US resident infant who was "transiting through" the Washington DC area. The two cases are unrelated and are likely the result of household transmission, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said.

282.title: 6 dead after Kanwariyas from Madhya Pradesh mowed down by truck in UP
282.article_body: At least six people died after Kanwariyas were mowed down by a speeding truck in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras district on Saturday. The devotees from Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior were returning from Haridwar when the truck ran over them at around 2:15 am, Rajeev Krishna, Additional Director General of Police, said. Police added probe in the matter is on.

283.title: Annu records best finish by an Indian in women's javelin throw at World C'ships
283.article_body: National record holder Annu Rani recorded the best finish by an Indian in women's javelin throw final in World Athletics Championships history. The 29-year-old finished seventh in the final at World Athletics Championships 2022 with a best throw of 61.12 metres. She bettered her own position, having finished eighth in the final of the World Athletics Championships 2019.

284.title: Delhi Police head constable shoots self with service pistol inside car
284.article_body: A Delhi Police Crime Branch head constable, identified as Narendra, was found dead inside his car in the parking area of the police colony in Laxmi Nagar on Friday, DCP (East) Priyanka Kashyap said. He allegedly shot himself dead using his service pistol. Narendra was troubled by family issues, as per the initial investigation. He joined Delhi Police in 2010.

285.title: Sufficient stock in dams after heavy rains, no water cuts for now: PMC
285.article_body: There will be no more water cuts in Pune city considering the sufficient water stock in all four dams upstream of Mutha river after heavy rains, Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) said. "Regular water supply will continue after July 26...there's no water cut planned," it added. The dams have a total of 20 TMC (thousand million cubic feet) of water stock.

286.title: Vince McMahon retires as WWE chief amid sexual misconduct allegations
286.article_body: Vince McMahon has retired as WWE chief amid sexual misconduct allegations against him. "As I approach 77 years old...I feel it's time for me to retire as Chairman and CEO of WWE," he said. WWE's board is investigating the allegations that McMahon paid more than $12 million to four different women to suppress allegations of sexual misconduct and infidelity.

287.title: Google fires engineer who claimed its AI chatbot 'behaved like a human'
287.article_body: Google has fired the software engineer who claimed that the company's AI chatbot LaMDA had become "sentient" and was behaving like a human being. While Blake Lemoine was placed on leave last month, Google said it had "extensively" reviewed Lemoine’s claims and found them "wholly unfounded". In June, Lemoine posted a detailed blog explaining his reasons for calling LaMDA "sentient".

288.title: PM Modi hosts farewell dinner for outgoing President Kovind, shares pics
288.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday hosted a farewell dinner for outgoing President Ram Nath Kovind. Sharing pictures, he wrote, "Hosted a dinner in honour of President Kovind Ji. Smt Droupadi Murmu Ji, Venkaiah Ji, other esteemed dignitaries including Ministers were present." He added, "We were also glad to welcome several grassroots level achievers, Padma awardees, tribal community leaders and others."

289.title: India record their 6th consecutive victory against West Indies in ODI cricket
289.article_body: India defeated West Indies by three runs in the first ODI in Trinidad's Port of Spain to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match series. India have now won six consecutive ODI matches against West Indies. Captain Shikhar Dhawan top-scored with 97(99) as India put up a total of 308/7. West Indies were restricted to 305/6 in their 50 overs.

290.title: Delhi CM skips weekly meeting called by LG amid tensions: Report
290.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal skipped the weekly meeting called by Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena on Friday, ANI reported. This comes after the LG refused to give permission to Kejriwal to travel to Singapore to attend the World Cities Summit. Notably, Saxena has also recommended a CBI probe into the alleged violations of the Arvind Kejriwal-led government's Excise Policy 2021-22.

291.title: Ukraine's military has potential to make gains on battlefield: Prez
291.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said his military forces can make gains on the battlefield against Russia and inflict "significant new losses on the occupiers". Zelenskyy's remarks came as UK intelligence said the Russian military was set to enter a period of operational pause in coming weeks. Russia is reportedly facing a shortage of critical resources in its war.

292.title: 19-year-old man arrested over Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal's murder
292.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested a 19-year-old man named Mohammed Javed in connection with the murder of Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal. He's the eight person to be arrested in the case. Kanhaiya was beheaded in his shop in June for sharing a social media post supporting the now-suspended BJP politician Nupur Sharma over her remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

293.title: NIA declares ₹10 lakh cash reward on fugitive terrorist Hardeep Nijjar
293.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) has announced a cash reward of ₹10 lakh on Canada-based fugitive terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar. The chief of Khalistan Tiger Force is linked to a conspiracy to kill a Hindu priest in Punjab last year. The conspiracy was allegedly hatched by Nijjar and another man, Arshdeep Singh, to disrupt the communal harmony in Punjab, NIA said.

294.title: UK drivers face hours-long delay at Dover Port
294.article_body: UK drivers faced hours-long delays at Dover Port on Friday, resulting in traffic snarls that stretched up to miles. Dover officials said shortage of French border officials led to waiting period going up to six hours. After Britain's exit from the European Union in 2020, UK travellers are subject to stricter border checks when traveling to the continent.

295.title: Ukraine & Russia sign UN-backed deal to resume Ukrainian grain exports
295.article_body: Russia and Ukraine signed separate but identical agreements with Turkey and the UN on Friday to resume the export of Ukrainian grains amid the war. UN Secretary-General António Guterres called it "a beacon of hope" for millions of people who have faced huge increases in food costs. The Russian military's blockade of Ukrainian ports had halted the grain exports.

296.title: Ravindra Jadeja to not feature in 2nd ODI against West Indies as well
296.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been ruled out of the second ODI against West Indies as well. Jadeja sustained an injury to his right knee and wasn't named in India's playing XI for the first ODI. "The BCCI Medical team is monitoring his progress and...decision on his participation in the third ODI will be taken accordingly," an official statement read.

297.title: 4 inter-state robbers among 7 arrested after encounter in Mathura
297.article_body: Four inter-state robbers were among the seven persons arrested following an encounter on Thursday with police in UP's Mathura district, a senior police official said. Five motorcycles and two 315-bore pistols with four live rounds were among the items recovered from the group's possession, the official added. According to police, two of the inter-state robbers were injured in the encounter.

298.title: ICJ dismisses Myanmar objections to case on Rohingya atrocities
298.article_body: The International Court of Justice on Friday rejected objections by Myanmar to a case holding the country responsible for genocide against the Rohingya ethnic minority. Gambia had filed the case in 2019, saying both countries are party to the 1948 Genocide Convention and must ensure it is enforced. Friday's hearing sets the stage for evidence being produced in court.

299.title: Biden's COVID-19 symptoms improved after Pfizer drug use: Doctor
299.article_body: US President Joe Biden's COVID-19 symptoms improved overnight after taking Pfizer Inc.'s Paxlovid drug for a full day, White House physician Kevin O’Connor said. He further said, “The president is fully vaccinated and twice-boosted, so I anticipate that he will respond favourably." O’Connor added, “There has been nothing... thus far which gives me cause to alter that initial expectation."

300.title: 2 babies killed as tree falls on house during storm in US' Alabama
300.article_body: Two infants were killed when a tree fell on a house during a storm in Alabama's Birmingham in the US. Three-month-old Jalaia Ford and 11-month-old Journee Jones were rushed to a hospital after the incident occurred on Thursday afternoon, authorities told the media. At least three other people were injured in the incident, Birmingham fire department said.

301.title: Russian central bank cuts key interest rate
301.article_body: Russia's central bank on Friday cut its key interest rate by 1.5 percentage points, to 8%, saying inflation was easing due to fall in consumer demand. The slash in rate comes as inflation expectations reached levels of spring 2021 and decline in business activity was slow. However, the central bank noted that the war with Ukraine had constrained economic activity.

302.title: Thai minister denies spyware use by govt after apparent admission
302.article_body: Thailand's Digital Economy Minister on Friday denied the use of spyware for surveillance by his government. Earlier on Tuesday, he had apparently admitted the use of spyware for national security and drug-related cases by the Thai government. "I said I knew of the system... but I did not say that it existed in the Thai government," he said in parliament.

303.title: Belarus Oppn Leader rejects reports of mobilisation of forces
303.article_body: Belarus' Opposition Leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya has rejected media reports that there was a secret mobilisation of forces in Belarus to join Russia in its war against Ukraine. Reacting to the reports, Tsikhanouskaya said it was a ploy for Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko to stay "in focus". She said Belarusian soldiers would not join the war.

304.title: Gabbar is back: Amit Mishra on Dhawan's 97 in 1st ODI vs West Indies
304.article_body: Praising Shikhar Dhawan following the India captain's 99-ball 97 against West Indies in first ODI, Amit Mishra took to Twitter and wrote, "Gabbar is back!! Missed out on a century but led India to driver's seat in this match." Dhawan shared a 119-run opening wicket partnership with Shubman Gill(64). Dhawan was dismissed by Gudakesh Motie in the 34th over.

305.title: Miscreants hurl 3 crude bombs at school gate in UP's Prayagraj
305.article_body: Unidentified miscreants hurled three crude bombs at the gate of Boys High School in Civil Lines area of UP's Prayagraj on Friday. The incident occurred shortly before the closing time of primary classes, the school principal said. No injury has been reported due to the incident. The incident was caught on CCTV camera.

306.title: Japan approves initial plans to release water from wrecked nuclear plant
306.article_body: Japan's nuclear regulatory body on Friday approved initial plans to release treated radioactive wastewater from the Fukushima nuclear plant which was destroyed in the 2011 tsunami. The approval gives Tokyo Electric Power Company the greenlight to build necessary infrastructure to discharge the water after treating it. According to plans, the water will be released into the sea next year.

307.title: 'Elvis' actress Shonka Dukureh found dead in her US apartment aged 44
307.article_body: Actress Shonka Dukureh, who portrayed 'Big Mama Thornton' in this year's movie 'Elvis', has died aged 44. According to the Nashville Metropolitan Police Department, she was found dead in the bedroom of her apartment that she shared with her two young children. Authorities don't suspect any foul play, however, they're awaiting autopsy results for an official cause of death.

308.title: BCCI introduce A+ category for umpires, include 10 umpires
308.article_body: The BCCI have introduced a new A+ category for umpires and have included 10 umpires in it. ICC Elite Panel member Nitin Menon is among the 10 officials grouped in the new category. Others include Anil Chaudhary, Madanagopal Jayaraman, Virender Kumar Sharma, K N Ananthapadmanabhan, Rohan Pandit, Nikhil Patwardhan, Sadashiv Iyer, Ulhas Gandhe and Navdeep Singh.

309.title: India supplied 23.9 cr COVID vaccines to 101 countries, UN entities
309.article_body: Minister of State, Health, Bharati Pravin Pawar on Friday said India has supplied 23.9 crore coronavirus vaccine doses to 101 countries and entities of the United Nations as of July 15, 2022. Pawar said 200.34 crore coronavirus vaccine doses have been administered in the country as of July 19, 2022. Currently, five coronavirus vaccines are available in the country.

310.title: India to host Australia, SA for 3 T20Is each before T20 WC: Ganguly
310.article_body: India will host South Africa and Australia for three T20Is each before going for the T20 World Cup 2022 in October, said BCCI President Sourav Ganguly. The dates and venues are yet to be confirmed. India recently hosted South Africa for a five-match T20I series in June, which ended in a 2-2 draw. World Cup will be held in Australia.

311.title: Truck driver electrocuted in Greater Noida, vehicle goes up in flames
311.article_body: A truck driver died on Thursday after his vehicle came in contact with a live wire in UP's Greater Noida, police said. According to police, the wire caused the driver to get electrocuted and his truck to catch fire while he was still inside. The driver was rushed to a nearby hospital where he was declared dead, police added.

312.title: Police arrests man who helped Haryana DSP murder accused flee to Raj
312.article_body: The Nuh Police on Friday arrested a man for harbouring the key accused in the murder case of Haryana DSP Surender Singh, who was mowed down by a truck while probing illegal stone mining in Haryana. The arrested man, Jabid, had helped key accused Sabbir flee to Rajasthan on his motorcycle. Police said Jabid is a native of Alwar, Rajasthan.

313.title: BSF seizes 41.4 kg gold worth ₹21.2 cr along India-Bangladesh border
313.article_body: Border Security Force (BSF) on Thursday seized 41.49 kg gold worth ₹21.22 crore along the India-Bangladesh border, BSF said on Friday. They seized five bags containing 321 gold biscuits, four gold bars, one gold coin and one wooden country-made boat. This is the biggest single seizure of gold by any Indian law enforcement agency along the India-Bangladesh border, BSF claimed.

314.title: 4 dead, 1 injured as roof collapses due to heavy rains in Patiala
314.article_body: Four members of a family were reported dead after the roof of a house collapsed amid heavy rainfall in Punjab's Patiala on Thursday. Another member of the family has been reported injured due to the incident. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted widespread rainfall with heavy isolated downpours and thunderstorms in UP, Punjab and Haryana.

315.title: Attack by suspected Islamist militants at Mali's main military base
315.article_body: The main military base of Mali, outside capital Bamako, where the country's interim President Colonel Assimi Goita resides came under an attack by Islamist militants on Friday, the military said. The attackers were "vigorously repelled" by the armed forces, the military added. A convoy carrying Colonel Goita left for Bamako from the Kati base after the gunfire subsided, Reuters reported.

316.title: Amber Heard files notice of appeal in Johnny Depp defamation case verdict
316.article_body: Actress Amber Heard has filed a notice of appeal against the verdict of the defamation case filed by her ex-husband Johnny Depp. Heard was directed to pay Depp $10 million. "We believe the court made errors that prevented a just and fair verdict," her spokesperson stated. Earlier, her request for a mistrial over an issue involving a juror was denied.

317.title: 7.9 lakh tonnes food transported in 2,359 Kisan rails since 2020: Govt
317.article_body: In response to a query in Rajya Sabha, the Centre has informed that 7.9 lakh tonnes of perishable food items were transported by 2,359 Kisan rails between August 7, 2020 and June 30, 2022. The Centre added that the highest number of Kisan Rails were operated from Maharashtra during 2020-22. The govt also said that 1,841 services ran in 2021-22.

318.title: SC appoints senior advocate Maninder Singh as amicus curiae in BCCI case
318.article_body: The Supreme Court has appointed senior advocate Maninder Singh as amicus curiae for the case relating to BCCI. Maninder, an ex-additional solicitor general of India, replaces PS Narasimha, who has now become a Supreme Court judge. The apex court has fixed the hearing on the plea of BCCI for amending its constitution concerning tenure of office bearers on July 28.

319.title: Govt shares category-wise list of vacancies in Armed Forces
319.article_body: The government told the Lok Sabha that there are 1,35,850 posts that are lying vacant in Armed Forces. In Indian Army, there are 7,308 vacancies for Officers, 471 for MNS Officers and 1,08,685 for JCOs/OR. There are a total of 13,597 vacancies in Navy. In Indian Air Force, there are 572 vacancies for posts of Officers and 5,217 for Airmen.

320.title: Suhana, Khushi not cast over being star kids: 'The Archies' casting director
320.article_body: The casting director of 'The Archies' Nandini Shrikent said that Suhana Khan, Khushi Kapoor and Agastya Nanda were not cast in the film because of being star kids, adding that it was because of acting powers. "Any industry you look at, the next generation takes over...Each [actor] is very specifically, super-perfect for the role they've been cast in," she said.

321.title: Chinese Prez Xi wishes Biden speedy recovery from COVID-19
321.article_body: China's President Xi Jinping wished his US counterpart Joe Biden a speedy recovery from coronavirus in a message on Friday, Chinese state media reported. Biden had mild symptoms and would work in isolation, the White House had said on Thursday. Notably, Biden has been fully vaccinated against coronavirus and has twice received booster jabs.

322.title: Will be fearing playing a team that has Virat Kohli in it: Ricky Ponting
322.article_body: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said that Virat Kohli still has the ability to have a "meaningful impact". "I think if I was an opposition captain or an opposition player, I will be fearing playing an Indian team that has Virat Kohli in it, more than I would be one that doesn't have him in it," Ponting noted.

323.title: Man arrested in Noida for escaping with employer's ₹3.25 lakh cash
323.article_body: A grocery shop employee was arrested by police in Noida on Thursday for allegedly fleeing with ₹3.25 lakh cash that the shop owner had given him for procuring items from Ghaziabad. According to police, the accused man had been working in the shop, located in Noida's Sector 58, for eight years. The accused was arrested from Khora T-point, police said.

324.title: Clashes between rival factions leave 13 dead in Libya's capital
324.article_body: Thirteen people were killed and 27 others were injured after clashes broke out between rival factions in Libya's capital Tripoli. A spokesperson for the Interior Ministry said that three of the dead were civilians. The clashes, one of the worst in the city over the past two years, come amid growing tensions between rival governments in the country.

325.title: EU drug agency recommends use of smallpox vaccine for monkeypox
325.article_body: The European Medicines Agency (EMA) on Friday recommended the use of smallpox vaccine Imvanex for the prevention of monkeypox. However, the health agency does not have the authority to permit marketing of the vaccine for monkeypox treatment in EU member nations. Only the European Commission can take a legally binding decision in this regard on the basis of the recommendation.

326.title: Govt to provide 5 units free electricity for planting tree: Jharkhand CM
326.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Friday announced the state government will provide five units free electricity to those planting and protecting a tree in their house. Speaking at Van Mahotsav programme in Ranchi, Soren said the decision was taken considering concretisation of urban areas. "It should be a proper tree, which'll help in conservation of nature in future," he added.

327.title: My film among champions is a pleasure: Madonne on National Award
327.article_body: Filmmaker Madonne Ashwin, who won the National Award for Best Debut Director for Tamil film 'Mandela', said finding his film among all the champions gives him a lot of pleasure. "I'm so happy that a small film...which was only released on an OTT platform has received such a response," he said. Madonne also won the Best Dialogue Writer for 'Mandela'.

328.title: Dominic Thiem and I want to find our top form again: Alexander Zverev
328.article_body: Germany's Alexander Zverev, who is currently rehabilitating his ankle after undergoing surgery, said he gets along very well with Austria's Dominic Thiem. "We both want to find our top form again because I still have an open account from our last Grand Slam match," he added. Thiem was sidelined for nine months after injuring his wrist in June 2021.

329.title: Tribute to father, Rajiv Kapoor: 'Toolsidas Junior' director on National Award
329.article_body: Speaking about the National Award for 'Toolsidas Junior', director Mridul Toolsidass said he can't imagine a greater tribute to his real and reel fathers. He added the film was his passion project to pay an ode to his father who was portrayed by late actor Rajiv Kapoor. "Unfortunately, my father as well as Rajiv sir passed away before...release," Mridul said.

330.title: It's for women in my life: Vasanth on National Award for 'Sivaranjiniyum...'
330.article_body: Speaking about 'Sivaranjiniyum Innum Sila Pengalum' winning three National Awards, director Vasanth said he considers this to be an award for the women in his life and the film. The film won Best Tamil Film, Best Supporting Actress for Lakshmipriyaa Chandramouli and Best Editing. 'Sivaranjiniyum Innum Sila Pengalum' is a three-part anthology based on short stories by Tamil writers.

331.title: India's 'first-of-its-kind' brain health clinic inaugurated in B'luru
331.article_body: A brain health clinic, said to be the first-of-its-kind in India, was inaugurated on Friday at Bengaluru's Jayanagar General Hospital by Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar. The minister said the clinic has been established by the Karnataka Health Department in association with NIMHANS institute. He said such clinics will also be inaugurated in Kolar and Chikkaballapura districts of Karnataka.

332.title: Head Constable arrested in Ludhiana, 1.8 kg poppy husk seized
332.article_body: Ludhiana Police on Friday said they have arrested a Police Head Constable, Anil Kumar, for allegedly being involved in drug peddling and seized 1.8 kg of poppy husk from him. Police said Kumar was deputed as the gunman for BJP Kisan Morcha National Secretary, Sukhminderpal Singh Grewal. Kumar was arrested during a special checking drive, the investigating officer said.

333.title: Taapsee-starrer 'Dobaaraa' to open Indian Film Festival of Melbourne
333.article_body: The upcoming thriller 'Dobaaraa' which features Taapsee Pannu and Pavail Gulati will be opening the 2022 Indian Film Festival of Melbourne. The Anurag Kashyap directorial premiered at the London Film Festival on June 23. 'Dobaaraa' is a remake of the 2018 Spanish film 'Mirage' which shows a mother who interacts with the ghost of a child to save his life.

334.title: Russia's military taking hundreds of casualties daily in Ukraine: US
334.article_body: Russia's military is taking hundreds of casualties a day in its war in Ukraine, a senior US defence official said on Friday. The death toll includes thousands of lieutenants and captains, the official added. Notably, Russia classifies military deaths as state secrets even in times of peace and has not updated its official casualty figures frequently during the war.

335.title: I'm a very cool captain: Dhawan on his captaincy style before 1st ODI vs WI
335.article_body: Talking about his captaincy style after the toss in first India-West Indies ODI, Shikhar Dhawan said he's a "very cool captain" and makes sure that the team's energy stays up. "And of course I love to take all...right decisions and keep the process going," he added. Dhawan is leading Team India for the three-match ODI series against West Indies.

336.title: Over 2,700 convicted for crimes against women, children in 3 months: UP govt
336.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Friday said 2,756 people accused of rape and other crimes against women and children were punished in three months. UP Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Kumar Awasthi stated from March 25 to July 16, 2022, 328 people were given life imprisonment, 594 people were sentenced for over 10 years and 1,834 for less than 10 years.

337.title: I want to watch 'Sholay' in Tamil, 'Nayakan' in Hindi: Madhavan
337.article_body: Speaking at an event, actor R Madhavan said that he wants to watch the 1975 Hindi film 'Sholay' in Tamil and the 1987 Tamil film 'Nayakan' in Hindi. "Sometimes you don't get to enjoy the performances because you are busy reading subtitles," the actor said. 'Sholay' features Amitabh Bachchan, Dharmendra, Amjad Khan and Sanjeev Kumar. 'Nayakan' features Kamal Haasan.

338.title: There's a need to standardise disaster management system: K'taka CM
338.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said that there is a need to standardise the disaster management system to reduce the impact of disasters on human lives. "For the last 10 years, the state has seen floods almost every alternate year," Bommai said. "It's not possible to prevent natural disasters, but we need...effective measures before and after disasters," Bommai said.

339.title: 4 out of 5 UNSC members support India's bid for permanent seat: Govt
339.article_body: Four out of five permanent members of the UN Security Council (UNSC) support India's candidature for a permanent seat in the top world body, the government informed the Lok Sabha. Various initiatives aimed at building international support for India are being undertaken, it said. "The matter is consistently taken up during bilateral and multilateral meetings at all levels," it added.

340.title: Goa restaurant run by Smriti Irani's daughter gets notice over alleged illegal bar licence
340.article_body: A restaurant operated by Union Minister Smriti Irani's daughter, Zoish, got a notice from the Goa Excise Commissioner for allegedly holding an illegal bar license. The show cause notice said, "The licence was renewed last month, despite the licence holder having passed away on 17/05/2021." The matter is set to be heard in court on July 29.

341.title: Truck overturns on auto after collision in Haryana; 7 killed, 4 injured
341.article_body: At least seven people were killed and four others sustained injuries after a speeding truck overturned on an auto-rickshaw after colliding with it in Haryana's Mewat district on Friday, police said. The injured persons have been admitted to a hospital for treatment, according to a police inspector. The highway was reportedly cleared with the help of a crane.

342.title: Ajinkya Rahane and wife Radhika expecting their 2nd child, share pic
342.article_body: Cricketer Ajinkya Rahane and his wife Radhika Rahane took to Instagram to announce that they are expecting their second child together. Sharing a picture, Radhika wrote, "October 2022." Ajinkya and Radhika were blessed with their first child, daughter Aarya, in October 2019. Ajinkya and Radhika got married in 2014.

343.title: I am rubber, Twitter is glue: Musk after Twitter partially blames him for drop in revenue
343.article_body: After Twitter partially blamed Elon Musk for its drop in revenue, the Tesla CEO tweeted, "I am rubber, Twitter is glue." Twitter's revenue fell year-on-year to $1.18 billion from $1.19 billion. The microblogging firm blamed the drop in revenue on "advertising weakness" and uncertainty related to its pending $44-billion acquisition by Elon Musk.

344.title: 32-year-old man from Andhra Pradesh found dead at Isha Yoga Centre in Tamil Nadu
344.article_body: A 32-year-old man from Andhra Pradesh was found dead in his room at Isha Yoga Centre near Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. As per Coimbatore District (Rural) Police Superintendent, V Badrinarayanan, the man, identified as Gullu Ramana, had come to the centre on July 15 to attend a six-month programme. "The cause of the death...would be known after the post-mortem," Badrinarayanan added.

345.title: Ricky Martin's husband shares pic with him after nephew withdraws sexual harassment claim
345.article_body: A judge on Thursday decided to not extend a temporary restraining order placed against singer Ricky Martin this month by his nephew after the relative dropped the sexual harassment case. Hours after the court ruling, Martin said that he was a "victim of lies". Martin's husband, Jwan Yosef, shared a picture with him on Instagram and wrote, "Truth prevails."

346.title: Maha CM lifts restrictions on festivals imposed due to COVID-19
346.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has lifted restrictions on festivals which were in force since March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Now, there will be no curbs on Ganesh Chaturthi, Dahi Handi, Muharram processions, among other religious events. The earlier restrictions included ban on processions and curbs on the height of Lord Ganesh idols.

347.title: Devotee donates gold crown worth ₹33 lakh to Shirdi Saibaba Temple
