347.article_body: An 80-year-old doctor from Hyderabad donated a gold crown worth ₹33 lakh to Saibaba Temple in Maharashtra's Shirdi on Friday, Shri Saibaba Sansthan Trust CEO Bhagyashree Banayat said. The crown which is studded with diamonds weighs 707 gms in total, she added. Dr Manda Ramkrishna said that he had fulfilled his promise to donate a gold crown to the shrine.

348.title: Forest dept looking for agents selling 'protected' land in Mumbai
348.article_body: Forest department officials are on the hunt for agents who are allegedly selling land and building houses at Sanjay Gandhi National Park in Mumbai which is a Protected Area. A man was detained in connection to the racket on Thursday from Kandivali East. Forest personnel are also being looked at for alleged support to the racket, officials said.

349.title: Over the moon, congratulations brother: Akshay on Suriya's National Award
349.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar took to Twitter to congratulate actor Suriya for winning the National Award for Best Actor along with Ajay Devgn for his film 'Soorarai Pottru'. Akshay wrote, "Over the moon to see #SooraraiPottru win the top honours at the National Awards. Heartfelt congratulations my brother...Humbled to be working in the Hindi adaptation of such an iconic film."

350.title: Good luck: Ashwin on Gill's return to ODIs after 18 months in Port of Spain
350.article_body: Reacting to India opener Shubman Gill's return to ODI cricket after 18 months, Ravichandran Ashwin tweeted, "Good luck Gill and team." The 22-year-old is playing in the first ODI against West Indies in Port of Spain today. He scored his maiden half-century in the format in 36 balls. Gill last played in an ODI in December 2020.

351.title: ED seizes ₹20 crore-cash after raids on Bengal minister Partha's aide, others
351.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday said it has seized cash worth ₹20 crore after raiding various premises, including the house of Arpita Mukherjee, an associate of West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee. The raids were conducted in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam. The amount is suspected to be proceeds of crime of the said SSC scam, ED stated.

352.title: Vijay Deverakonda wears slippers worth ₹199 at 'Liger' trailer launch
352.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda, who will make his Bollywood debut with 'Liger', wore slippers worth ₹199 at the trailer launch of the film. His stylist Harmann Kaur revealed that the actor wanted to "keep a very underdog look" to "be closest to the character". "I was constantly nervous...and walking in wearing chappals worth ₹199 was really brave of Vijay," Harmann said.

353.title: Reliance Industries' profit jumps 46% to ₹17,955 crore, revenue up 54% in Q1
353.article_body: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries Limited's (RIL) consolidated net profit jumped 46.3% to ₹17,955 crore in the April-June quarter from ₹12,273 crore a year ago. Meanwhile, RIL's revenue from operations came in at ₹2,23,113 crore from ₹1,44,372 crore, an increase of 54.5% year-on-year. Further, Reliance Jio reported 23.8% rise in standalone net profit at ₹4,335 crore in Q1.

354.title: 15-16 Cong MLAs voted for Murmu in Presidential poll: Assam CM
354.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday claimed that 15-16 Congress MLAs from the state voted for NDA's nominee Droupadi Murmu in the Presidential election. Assam Congress President Bhupen Bora also admitted that there was cross-voting in the Presidential poll. The Congress has 27 MLAs in Assam Legislative Assembly, but three of them have been suspended due to anti-party activities.

355.title: MPs walk out of Parliamentary panel meet, say Agnipath discussion denied
355.article_body: BSP MP Danish Ali and Congress MPs KC Venugopal and Uttam Kumar Reddy, who are part of Parliamentary Standing Committee on Defence, walked out of the committee's meeting on Friday. Venugopal said they had walked out in protest after committee Chairman Jual Oram refused to hold a discussion on the "controversial" Agnipath scheme despite their repeated requests.

356.title: I'm elated to win Best Actor: Ajay Devgn on National Award for 'Tanhaji'
356.article_body: Ajay Devgn, who received the Best Actor Award at the National Awards along with Suriya, said that he is elated to win for 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'. "I thank everyone, most of all my creative team, the audience and my fans," he added. This is Ajay's third National Award for Best Actor after 'Zakhm' and 'The Legend of Bhagat Singh'.

357.title: India equal Sri Lanka's world record for having most captains in a calendar year
357.article_body: India on Friday equalled Sri Lanka's world record for having most captains in a calendar year. After taking the field in the first ODI against West Indies, Shikhar Dhawan became the seventh captain to lead India in international cricket in 2022. Sri Lanka used seven captains in 2017. No team has had more than seven captains in a calendar year.

358.title: Ex-world no. 3 Thiem reaches 1st Tour-level semis in 14 months in Gstaad
358.article_body: Ex-world number three Dominic Thiem reached his first ATP Tour semi-final since May 2021 after defeating Peruvian qualifier Juan Pablo Varillas 6-4, 6-3 at EFG Swiss Open Gstaad on Friday. The Austrian, who is currently ranked 274, missed the second half of the last season due to wrist injury. Thiem will face second seed Matteo Berrettini in the semi-final.

359.title: Bhuvan Bam injured while shooting for 'Taaza Khabar', calls it freak accident
359.article_body: YouTuber Bhuvan Bam recently injured himself while shooting an action sequence for his upcoming web show 'Taaza Khabar'. He reportedly injured his left arm and shoulder but resumed shooting after a break. "It was a freak accident during the action scenes. Thankfully it wasn't serious. We could thankfully resume the shoot almost immediately after a small break," the YouTuber said.

360.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad police to act against men loitering near schools
360.article_body: Commissioner of Police, Pimpri-Chinchwad, Ankush Shinde has ordered all officials in-charge of police stations to take action against men found loitering near schools and colleges. Officials released helpline numbers 112 and 020-27352500 to share information on persons misbehaving with women and girl students. The move comes as in-classroom studies have begun in the state.

361.title: Indian pair of Tanisha-Ishaan loses in quarters at Taipei Open
361.article_body: India's mixed doubles pair of Ishaan Bhatnagar and Tanisha Crasto crashed out of the Taipei Open after losing in the quarter-final on Friday. The sixth seeds lost to unseeded Malaysians Hoo Pang Ron and Toh Ee Wei 19-21, 12-21 in 32 minutes. Tanisha also lost in women's doubles quarter-final. Meanwhile, third seed Parupalli Kashyap lost in men's singles quarter-final.

362.title: Uncertainty on members per ward in Pimpri-Chinchwad civic polls
362.article_body: The final voters' list for the Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation polls has been released but uncertainty prevails on whether the elections will be held on a three-member ward system. The previous Maha Vikas Aghadi government had changed the system to a three-member ward system. Civic officials said the proposal to revert to the old four-member system is before the new Cabinet.

363.title: Follow your inner calling: PM to those who cleared CBSE Class 12 exams
363.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday congratulated students who cleared the CBSE Class 12 exams. "They prepared for these exams through a time when humanity faced a monumental challenge and achieved this success," he said. The PM urged them to follow their inner calling and pursue subjects they are passionate about.

364.title: Indian wrestling team is the best: WFI President ahead of CWG 2022
364.article_body: Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) President Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh has said the country's team is the best in the upcoming Commonwealth Games 2022. "However, you can't say we will win all (12) the gold medals because someday, luck also plays a part," he added. CWG will begin on July 28 in Birmingham. Wrestling events to start on August 5.

365.title: 2 criminals wanted in cases including murder arrested in Haryana
365.article_body: Two criminals wanted in multiple cases have been arrested in separate incidents in Haryana, police said. Lokesh alias Gogi was arrested in Rohtak. Police said he was wanted in eight cases including that of murder, attempt to murder and kidnapping. The second criminal, Bijender alias Punji, was wanted in nearly a dozen cases including that of murder, police added.

366.title: ₹100-200 crore club puts pressure on experimenting with subjects: Vaani
366.article_body: Actress Vaani Kapoor has stated in an interview that the concept of the ₹100-200 crore club has put a lot of pressure on filmmakers to continue creating art. "People get scared of experimenting with subjects," she added. The actress further said that it gets harder to mount films on people who are not already at the top of their game.

367.title: Putin is healthy: CIA chief on rumours about Russian Prez's health
367.article_body: Speaking at a security forum, CIA chief Bill Burns said, "There are lots of rumours about President [Vladimir] Putin's health and as far as we can tell, he's entirely too healthy." However, Burns clarified that his remark didn't constitute "a formal intelligence judgment". Notably, Russia has accused Ukraine, the UK and the US of spreading fake information about Putin's health.

368.title: Shoppers Stop announces Weekend Special Offer
368.article_body: Inspired by the fantastic response received on their ongoing sale, Shoppers Stop has decided to go bigger by giving irresistible deals and discounts this weekend, the brand revealed. Customers can avail ‘Buy 1 Get 1’ offer on brands across men's, women's and kids' wear categories. The brand also announced 'Buy 2 at 50% off' offer from July 22 to 24.

369.title: ED seizes jewels, bank deposits worth ₹253 crore of Nirav Modi's firms in Hong Kong
369.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has attached gems, jewellery and bank deposits worth ₹253.62 crore of companies linked to fugitive diamond merchant Nirav Modi in Hong Kong as part of a money laundering probe. With this, the total attached and seized assets tally in the case stands at ₹2,650.07 crore, the ED said. Nirav is presently lodged in a UK jail.

370.title: Amazing to be noticed in debut 'Samrat...': Manushi on signing 'Tehran'
370.article_body: Speaking about signing her third film 'Tehran', actress Manushi Chhillar said that it is amazing to have been noticed for her work in debut film 'Samrat Prithviraj'. The film, which features John Abraham, is based on true events. "I...love this genre of films that are inspired by true events and I hope to do my best in 'Tehran'," she added.

371.title: It's our fortune a tribal woman will grace Prez's post: Arjun Munda
371.article_body: Union Tribal Affairs Minister Arjun Munda on Friday said that it is our fortune that a tribal woman will grace the post of the country's President. "Years after independence, India and its tribal community are growing with new opportunities," he said. His comment comes after Droupadi Murmu was elected as the 15th President of India.

372.title: Jewellery store burgled, valuables worth ₹41 lakh stolen in Thane
372.article_body: Police on Friday said that unidentified persons broke into a jewellery store and stole valuables worth ₹41 lakh in Thane. The accused damaged a wall of a tyre shop next to it and entered the store in Vartak Nagar, police added. The accused stole 652 grams of gold and 40 kg of silver worth ₹41 lakh, police said.

373.title: Cong-JD(S) coalition govt an outcome of 'selfish politics': K'taka CM
373.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that the Congress-JD(S) coalition government in the state was the outcome of 'selfish politics'. "We have seen the worst kind of selfish politics in 2018-19 when alliances were formed with everyone, law and order was compromised to retain power," Bommai said. "That is the politics of attaining and retaining power," he added.

374.title: Not the time for ego: Oppn VP candidate on TMC's decision to skip polls
374.article_body: Opposition's Vice President candidate Margaret Alva on Friday called TMC's decision to abstain from voting in Vice Presidential elections "disappointing". "This isn't the time for 'whataboutery', ego or anger," she said. "This is the time for courage, leadership and unity. I believe Mamata Banerjee, who is the epitome of courage, will stand with the Opposition," Alva added.

375.title: Upcoming Pune-B'luru corridor to reduce distance between the cities by 95 km
375.article_body: The upcoming Pune-Bengaluru Greenfield corridor is going to reduce the distance between the two cities by 95 km and travel time by around four to five hours, as per reports. The current distance between the cities is 840 km, which will be reduced to 745 km with the new corridor. The project is in the proposal stage.

376.title: Bihar man kills mother, said her witchcraft killed his wife: Report
376.article_body: A man named Badri Manjhi murdered his mother with an axe and seriously injured his father in Bihar's Naubatpur area on Thursday. This came after Badri's wife developed a severe stomach ache and later died in a hospital. According to a report, Badri attacked his parents after claiming that his wife had died due to 'tantra-mantra' (witchcraft) used by them.

377.title: Have been hearing it for 10 years now, it doesn't matter to me: Dhawan on criticism
377.article_body: On being asked about facing criticism almost every time after failing to score big in a couple of matches, Shikhar Dhawan said, "I don't feel strange. I have been hearing it for 10 years now." "They keep saying, I keep playing. It doesn't matter to me. If it did, I wouldn't have been here today," Dhawan added.

378.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st ODI against West Indies
378.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the first ODI. Captain Shikhar Dhawan and Shubman Gill will open the batting for India, while Shreyas Iyer has been named vice-captain. India's playing XI also includes Sanju Samson, Deepak Hooda, Axar Patel and Prasidh Krishna.

379.title: WI looking forward to India series to correct some rights, wrongs: Pooran
379.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said his side is looking forward to correcting some rights and wrongs in ODI series against India. West Indies were whitewashed 3-0 against Bangladesh at home. "We're just looking forward to some things going our way because the guys have been putting in a lot of work," he added. First ODI will be played today.

380.title: Salman Khan seeks weapon licence over death threat letter: Report
380.article_body: Actor Salman Khan has submitted an application to Mumbai Police seeking a weapon licence for personal protection, as per reports. This comes after Salman and his father Salim Khan received a death threat letter last month. A video showed Salman leaving the office of Mumbai Police Commissioner Vivek Phansalkar on Friday.

381.title: Jail guard injured after car knocks him down at checkpoint in Gurugram
381.article_body: Gurugram Police on Thursday said that a jail guard, Sanjay Kumar, was injured after being knocked down by a private car at an entry checkpoint of Bhondsi jail. The driver of the car also threatened to kill Kumar before fleeing the scene. "We have identified the car and are conducting raids to nab the driver," an official said.

382.title: SC allows govt to continue with security cover for Mukesh Ambani, family
382.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday allowed the Centre to continue providing security cover for Reliance Industries' Mukesh Ambani and his family in Mumbai. A vacation bench on June 29 had stayed the orders of Tripura HC on a PIL challenging the grant of security cover to the family. The SC said there was no justification for it to be heard.

383.title: Only SC can examine disputes arising from Prez polls: Delhi HC
383.article_body: All disputes arising from the Presidential or Vice Presidential election can only be examined and decided upon by the Supreme Court, said the Delhi High Court. The court was responding to a petition which sought to prevent lawmakers imprisoned in criminal cases from casting their vote. The plea is not maintainable according to the Constitution, the court said.

384.title: Thought Nadal was going to play until young, he's playing until old: Gonzalez
384.article_body: Former world number five Fernando Gonzalez has said he thought 22-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal was going to play until young and he is playing until old. "It stopped surprising me," he added. The 36-year-old has won 35 out of 38 matches this season so far. He won four titles, including Grand Slams in Australia and France.

385.title: Man with smuggled gold worth ₹1.21 cr arrested at Varanasi airport
385.article_body: Customs officials seized over two-kg gold of foreign origin from a passenger at Varanasi airport on Friday. The man had come to Varanasi from the UAE in an Air India Express flight. "[The smuggled] gold was kept in the form of 20 gold bars, concealed in black tape and wrapped under waist," an official said. The accused has been arrested.

386.title: 'Forrest Gump' can't be translated, 'Laal...' is very desi: Atul Kulkarni
386.article_body: Actor Atul Kulkarni, who will make his film writing debut with Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said that the original 1994 film 'Forrest Gump' cannot be translated and only adapted. "Everything is Indianised in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. It's a very desi film made for Indian audiences," he added. Atul and Aamir earlier worked together in 2006 film 'Rang De Basanti'.

387.title: I'm an entirely new person: Naga Chaitanya on divorce with Samantha
387.article_body: Speaking about his divorce with Samantha Ruth Prabhu, Naga Chaitanya said that he is "an entirely new person". He said that he has changed a lot, adding he couldn't open up much earlier but is able to now. "Feeling very much attached to my family...and friends," he added. The two got married in 2017 and announced their separation in 2021.

388.title: Video shows Ajoy asking to be 'detained' after Cong protests, he replies
388.article_body: A video of Congress leader Ajoy Kumar asking to be taken inside the police bus which was carrying detained Congress leaders after Thursday's protests has gone viral. The video showed Kumar saying, "You need to take me yaar...Humko bhi ghusne do." He later tweeted, "The bus was full...Had it been a demonstration of the RSS-BJP, the bus would've remained empty."

389.title: Who won what at the National Film Awards announced today?
389.article_body: 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' won Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment at the 68th National Film Awards announced on Friday. Biju Menon won Best Supporting Actor for Malayalam film 'AK Ayyappanum Koshiyum'. Lakshmipriyaa Chandramouli won Best Supporting Actress for 'Sivaranjiniyum Innum Sila Pengalum' (Tamil). Sachidanandan KR won Best Direction award for 'AK Ayyappanum Koshiyum'.

390.title: How much money does Virat Kohli earn from each sponsored post on Instagram?
390.article_body: As per the HopperHQ's Instagram Rich List 2022, former India captain Virat Kohli earns $1,088,000 (₹8.69 crore) per sponsored post on Instagram. Kohli is currently placed 14th on the HopperHQ's Instagram Rich List 2022. He is the only Asian among the top 25 on the list. Cristiano Ronaldo is on top of the list, earning $2,397,000 per sponsored Instagram post.

391.title: Govt shares state-wise list of MBBS seats in the country
391.article_body: The Centre informed the Lok Sabha that there are 612 medical colleges in the country with MBBS seats. Tamil Nadu has the highest number of seats (10,725), followed by Karnataka (10,145). Maharashtra has 9,895 MBBS seats, while Uttar Pradesh has 9,053 seats. Out of the total 91,927 seats in the country, 48,012 are government seats, while 43,915 are private seats.

392.title: Shardul is not a good all-rounder like teammate Hardik: Styris
392.article_body: On being asked if India all-rounder Shardul Thakur should play all three ODIs against West Indies, Scott Styris said that Shardul isn't as good an all-rounder as teammate Hardik Pandya. He added that Shardul is fighting for a backup spot rather than one of the players to play as a frontline. Hardik has been rested for the India-West Indies series.

393.title: Wished Murmu on behalf of the people of Odisha: Naveen Patnaik
393.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Friday said he spoke to newly-elected President Droupadi Murmu and wished her all the very best on behalf of the people of Odisha. "Entire family of 4.5 crore people of Odisha are proud of her achievement," Patnaik tweeted. President-elect Droupadi Murmu was born in a tribal family in Odisha.

394.title: Hyderabad couple dies by suicide by consuming poison, bodies found
394.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Thursday found the bodies of two people, who allegedly died by suicide after consuming poison, and the police suspect that the deceased were in a relationship. Their bodies were discovered in an open space by locals. Police said the man was identified as 25-year-old Satish, a resident of Nalgonda, and the woman's age was ascertained at 23.

395.title: Temple desecrated in Bihar's Kishanganj; 1 arrested
395.article_body: A temple was desecrated in Bihar's Kishanganj district by some "anti-social elements" on Friday, an official said. The devotees found the idol at the Kali temple vandalised which led to the Bajrang Dal, among others, staging a demonstration, the SDM said. He added that the situation is now under control and one of the suspects has been arrested.

396.title: Ajay Devgn, Suriya get Best Actor National Award; Aparna Balamurali named Best Actress
396.article_body: The government today announced the 68th National Film Awards. The award for the Best Actor was won jointly by Ajay Devgn for Hindi film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' and Suriya for Tamil film 'Soorarai Pottru'. Meanwhile, Aparna Balamurali was named the Best Actress for 'Soorarai Pottru'. The Tamil movie also won the award for Best Feature Film.

397.title: Have gone through mental health issues as a youngster: Robin Uthappa
397.article_body: India cricketer Robin Uthappa revealed that he has gone through "mental health issues" during his younger days. Speaking at an event to mark World Brain Day in Bengaluru, Uthappa said, "I will, in my capacity, do everything to...tell [common man] about the importance of mental health." Notably, Uthappa is the brand ambassador of the Karnataka Brain Health Initiative.

398.title: Traffic curbs issued in Hyderabad in view of Bonalu procession
398.article_body: Hyderabad City Police has issued traffic restrictions in view of Ujjaini Mahankali Bonalu procession on July 25 in the city. Diversions will be enforced from 12 pm to 11 pm on Monday. The Hyderabad Traffic Police requested citizens to avoid the roads that lead to Aliyabad, Lal Darwaza Temple and Mohammed Shukoor Mosque and announced alternate routes for the same.

399.title: Japan identifies China, Russia & N Korea as main security concerns
399.article_body: Japan has identified China, Russia and North Korea as its main security concerns in a defence white paper. It has warned Russia's use of force to resolve a dispute established a precedent that threatens the security of Taiwan, which China claims as its territory. Japan called Russia's invasion of Ukraine a "serious violation of international law".

400.title: I'm living proof of the fact that nepotism never matters: Kashmera Shah
400.article_body: Actress Kashmera Shah, while speaking about nepotism, said, "If someone speaks about nepotism in Bollywood, I take it very personally because I'm living proof of the fact that nepotism never matters." "I was good and hence I got work, thereby helping me shine in this industry. Hence, I don't like people talking against it," Kashmera added.

401.title: Kerala's child rights body directs state to make all schools co-ed
401.article_body: The Kerala Child Rights Commission has directed the education department to convert all schools in the state into co-ed. "We issued an order...[after] we received a complaint in this regard. The aim is to protect our constitutional right to equality," said Manoj Kumar, Chairman of the Child Rights Commission. He added that gender equality should begin at the school level.
